1111.content:
Five friends had talked their parents into letting them go together to Dinsey World. Now they were here at last. They got here very early because none of them could sleep the night before because of their excitement!

There was Randy, the confident one, Ken, who usually fussed over what was happening but usually deferred to what Ken wanted in the long run, then there was Jeff, the quiet but manipulative one, John was immature, and Paul was just shy and quiet no matter what.

They went on several rides, but it was still early. Then John saw some girls standing in one of the lines. "Hey! Let's go on that ride!" Of course, as a teen boy, he was looking at just the girls.

However, Ken said, "You just want to talk to the girls! That is a girl's ride. It is not a thrill ride! It won't be fun!"

Jeff liked to tweak Ken when he could, "So? It might be fun if we meet some pretty girls!"

In the end, all but Randy agreed to go on the ride. It was actually boring to them until they got to a dark tunnel. It was pitch black and they couldn't see their hand in front of their face. Then suddenly, lights were flashing and they were soon dizzy and disoriented! It was do deeply disturbing that they got off the ride and were outside without knowing how they go there.

They had been the last ones off. As they were trying to get their heads together, Randy walked up to them and said, "Hi! My name is Randy. Did you girls happen to notice four guys getting off of that ride?
1111.title: A group of Teenage Boys become Teenage Girls

choices: The three girls start to get strange hair color and grow wings
11111.content:
The group heard Randy, and their minds quickly began to clear. They looked at him, looked at each other, then at themselves. Each wanted to scream as they realized what had happened, but they found they couldn't. When they finally caught their breath though, Ken, who was not a cute brunette in a jean skirt said, "Randy? Randy! It is us! I am Ken, or at least, I was!"

Randy shook his head, and somehow he knew this pretty girl was telling the truth! "How? How did this happen?"

John, now a pretty blonde girl said, "Well duh! It was the ride! We need to talk to someone and get them to change us back!"

Randy frowned as he said, "Good luck with that. They closed it after you got into the line. You were the last ones I saw come out." They did look, and sure enough, there was nobody who to be found.

Ken was ready to cry, "Now what can we do?"

Randy could tell how upset she was and felt the need to comfort her, "Don't worry Abby. They can't keep it closed all day. It is still early. We can find something to do and we will check back before lunch."

Ken looked up, "What did you call me?"

Randy blushed, "Um, sorry Ken. I don't know why, but Abby came out."

Ken shook her head. "Its okay Randy. The strangest thing is it felt right."

Eventually, they all agreed to move on. The biggest difference between the girls being their hair. While John was a natural blonde, and Ken had long chestnut hair, Jeff had long, dirty-blonde hair and Paul had short brown hair similar to Ken's.

Things got stranger as the time passed. Ken got shorter, but by lunch, the other three girls were much smaller, and looking younger. Then Paul came up to Ken and said, "I am scared. May I hold you hand?"

Ken looked down at her, "Um, sure Erin." Somehow they both felt better that way.

They ate lunch, and it was only after they were done that the realized that they had ordered three kid's meals.

They looked at each other. Randy finally said what they were thinking, "What is going on?"

111111.content:
Ken/Abby said, "I don't know, but let's try to find someone at that ride again before this goes much farther!"

Jeff looked up at her, "Much farther! How much farther could this go mommy?"

Ken/Abby smiled at her, "Don't worry honey. I sure we can fix this." Then she stared at Randy. "Did she just call me mommy and I just call her honey?" He nodded.

Then Randy snapped at John, "Sandy! Stop teasing Erin! Leave your sister alone!" They all froze. They stared at each other a whiled and realized that Randy and Ken/Abby seemed a bit older also, like in their 20's now. Randy said, "Let's go and fix this soon!"

Unfortunately, they had traveled far from the ride that had changed them. Randy and Abby looked at the map and found the shortest way. As they walked, the three girls seems to get younger by the minute. They passed some kiddy rides and just like that, John/Sandy said, "I want to go on that ride first!" Before anyone could say a word, she bolted for the line!

Abby groaned and pointed at Jeff, "Sharon, you stay here with your dad!" She did not even realize what she had said until she was almost caught up with John/Sandy. When she got there, John/Sandy threw a tantrum until Abby was so embarrassed that she gave in, "Okay, but only if you take your little sister on the ride too."

John/Sandy looked at Paul/Erin, who was now getting quite small and sucking her thumb and groaned, Aw mom! What if she messes her diaper or something on the ride?"

It was only then that they realized that you could see a bit of a diaper bulge showing under her cute little sun dress if she moved the right way. Abby was firm, "We need to get moving. Either take her on the ride or we leave now."

John/Sandy was not happy, "Oh, okay." But she was not happy.

Randy walked up to Abby, "I hope you don't mind, but since Sandy and Erin were going on a ride, I told Sharon she could go on one too."

She stared at him, but then said, "No, I suppose that is fair." She could have screamed on the inside because what she was thinking was, 'He is a good dad.' Though that was not the part that bothered her. The bad part was when she thought, 'I wish I could give him a boy.'

By the time the girls got off of the rides, Jeff/Sharon looked to be about seven and had long, straight dirty blonde hair to her waist and was wearing purple shorts and a pink t-shirt that said 'Girl Power!'. John/Sandy looked about four and was wearing a blue skirt and a powder blue t-shirt with pink writing that said, 'Daddy's Princess' and had wavy bright blond hair just past her shoulders, and Paul/Erin looked to be about two-years-old with short brown hair and was wearing a pink sundress with Ariel the mermaid on it.

Abby gasped and said, "Randy! Look!"

But before he could stop her, Jeff/Sharon had run to another ride. As soon as he put John/Sandy down, she ran to a different one. Paul/Erin was fussing and went over to a stroller that they suddenly knew was theirs! She sat down and fell asleep.

Ken/Abby said, "Randy. What are we going to do? I don't want to be a wife and mother! I am supposed to be a guy!"

She was almost in tears. Randy hugged her tight and said, "I know. It will be alright Abby." Suddenly, Randy felt something strange in his crotch. It was an intense sexual release, as though he had just dumped his load, and the sexual feelings were totally focused on Abby. He heard Abby gasp. He looked down at her, "Abby. Something strange just happened. I don't know what it was." He could tell his pants were not wet, so was it real?

Ken/Abby gasped, "Oh my! I, I felt something too. It felt like, well," She had felt like she had been penetrated, and then felt something warm enter deep inside of her. She was not sure what disturbed her more. The fear that she knew what that warm feeling inside of her was since it was now leaking from her pussy, or the fact that she loved the way it felt! "I, um, I need to use the restroom." She had to go clean up! When she did, she confirmed that what was leaking out of her could only have come from her husband. "Husband?" She wondered out loud.

When she got back, Randy had corralled the girls, who seemed to have stopped changing.

Abby took Erin back into the bathroom to change her diaper, and when she came out, Randy looked at her and said, "As if we need it, we have more problems."

11111111.content:
Ken/Abby looked down and gasped! Her abdomen was protruding out in a way that could only indicate one thing! "I look, well, I mean, well it looks…" She could not say it.

Randy said, "You look like you are pregnant Abby."
Ken/Abby was in shock a moment. Then she began to move fast. She strapped Erin into the stroller where she was sleeping. Then she looked up at Randy, "You hold the girl's hands and let's go! We need to get back to that ride!"

Ken/Abby was thankful that her pregnancy did not seem to progress any further. Somehow along the way she knew that she was almost four months pregnant. The girls whined, but Randy drug them along, carrying both of them at one point. It was getting late when they got to the place where the ride was.

All of them but Erin, who was still sleeping, stared. Where the ride had been was now a bunch of souvenir shops and food vendors with an open seating area! It was Jeff/Sharon who spoke first, "Does this mean we are going to stay like this? Are you going to stay my mommy?"

They could not talk. Finally Randy said, "Come on honey. I think we need to head back to the room and figure out what is going on." He put his arm protectively around Ken/Abby, who did not protest, but only nodded her head.

The room they went back to was different. It was a suite with two larger bedrooms with king size beds. From the luggage they could tell that one room was for the girls, and the other for Randy and Ken/Abby.

The girls jumped around on their bed for a while. John/Sandy said, "It is not so bad being a girl. I kind of like it. Sides, I get to play again!" But soon, all of them were soundly sleeping. Randy closed their door.

He looked at Ken/Abby, who looked very upset. He held her tight, and she held him back. "I am sorry Abby. I know this has to be hard on you."

After a while, she said, "It is not your fault. You were the one who tried to talk us out of going on that ride." She hugged him tighter, "But I have a feeling this is permanent. There is no going back." She looked up at him, "And if I have to be pregnant, I think I would really like to know what it feels like to, well, to do what a couple does to get pregnant."

Randy said, "Are you sure? I mean, really sure?" He desperately wanted to make love to his new wife, but he loved her too much to force her. When she nodded, that was all that it took. He began to kiss her passionately! And to his surprise, she was kissing him back! He picked her up and carried her into their bedroom. He made sure to lock the door just in case.

After an hour of intense passion, he was laying on his back, and Abby had her head on his chest. She had enjoyed what they did so much that she ceased to think of herself in any male terms anymore and she said so, "If you can make me feel like that every time, I not only am glad I am a woman now, I don't even mind that I am pregnant!" She stroked his chest, "I just hope I can give you a boy this time."

He stroked her head and smiled as he said, "If not, I guess we will just have to keep trying!" He was a little surprised that she did not protest that idea the way he thought she would!

As they snuggled in bed, there was the knock of small hands on the bedroom door, and attempts to open the locked door.

Jeff was planning on asking Randy what the hell he was talking about. He felt the words on his lips, his eyebrows raised for maximum bewilderment.

Instead, his hands went to rest on his hips as he fixed Randy with a playful grin. "Nobody like that. Are you sure they're the people you should be looking for?"

He blinked in surprise. His voice was higher in pitch and there was such a distinctly flirtatious tone to it. Did that come from his mouth?

John brushed long blonde hair out of his eyes. He didn't remember it getting this long. He glanced at the brunette next to him. Wasn't Jeff supposed to be there? Yet instead of asking questions, John leaned on Not-Jeff's shoulder to peer at Randy.

"Yeah! We're a looooooot more interesting to talk to. Or not talk to. Either's fine by me as long as you're fun~"

Randy smiled nicely at the two girls. They were pretty stunning. "You definitely seem like interesting people to me. I wouldn't mind talking more if I wasn't waiting for my friends."

Paul straightened his glasses, which he could've sworn weren't nearly this powerful a few minutes ago. He glanced down at himself to see that he was wearing a huge sweater, which covered almost everything about himself. He got the sense that something was different below that sweater but he felt a distinct sensation that it wouldn't be appropriate to remove the sweater. As if it protected from being leered at or something.

Jeff and John were supposed to be in front of him, yet a brunette and a blonde were flirting heavily with Randy. The brunette who wasn't Jeff wore an outfit that looked deliberate and manipulative in a way he was struggling to define. She wore a short skirt, but not too short, wore a top with some noticeable cleavage, but not too much cleavage, and what make-up he could see was placed to emphasize the lips, for reasons he couldn't understand.

The blonde, who wasn't John but was standing where John should be, had this energetic and girly spirit to her. Long hair, more overt clothing, and a purse with a whole batch of Disney pins attached to every free space. She screamed immature, but in a different way than John was.

"Oh trust us, we've met before," grinned Jeff. He didn't know why he was teasing Randy like this and, more importantly, why Randy was buying it. "But we can reintroduce ourselves."

Jeff pointed to himself. "I'm Jenny." He gestured to the blind John. "This is Jordan." He gestured behind them towards Paul. "That's Paula."

Paul squeaked when Randy looked at him, hiding himself among his hair. His hair had gotten longer too...?

"And the worrywart is Kendra." Ken had been struggling to pay attention, puzzled as he was by his own changes in appearance. His hair was still short, but it was styled into a ponytail. He wore practical jeans, but his t-shirt had become a tank top. His chest was substantially bigger and it was only now that the others were realizing the newfound girth of their chests.

Ken blew a hair from his eyes, glancing at Randy without much amusement. "Are you guys done playing around? He probably fed that line to every girl that walked through before us."

Randy lifted up his hands in mock surprise. "Honest to goodness, just looking for my friends. So you haven't seen them?" Randy was starting to suspect they had snuck away with some other girls they'd run into.

How come "Jordan" got to make the first move? Randy approached him first. He began to reach over herself, determined to be the first to tease and toy with Randy...

Only for Ken to suddenly grab John and Jeff's hands. "Hey!"

"Sorry, haven't seen them, pal. We really gotta get going to the next ride." And ignoring the girls' protests, Ken dragged John and Jeff off, Paul following quickly behind. Sighing, Randy focused back on the ride. Where were they?

Ken rolled his eyes. "Not my kind of fun."

Jordan pouted. "Randy had no clue! We really could have made him blush."

Jenny huffed. "She's just jealous because Randy didn't even look at her. It's cause of that attitude she's got that she doesn't have a boyfriend."

The duo giggled as Ken felt his face go red. Randy just wasn't his type! "So you were interested in Randy? Our Randy. The Randy."

Jenny primped her hair. "I mean, have you seen Randy?"

Jordan giggled again. "Like, what an absolute-"

It was at that moment that Jeff and John seemed to spark back into Jenny and Jordan. "...hunk. What the hell?"

Ken gestured pointedly. "What the hell is right. Have you been listening to yourselves?"

Jeff rubbed her forehead. "N-no yeah, I see your point. It just felt right to say."

"It still feels right to say. Like, this is freaky right?" John twirled a hair nervously. "Like, I'm weirded out, but I also really wanna go flirt with Randy some more. Or do my nails? And both of that feels normal?"

Jeff nodded. "Kind of? I mean, I just keep thinking- I mean, look at me!" Jeff struck a hip. "This is horrifying! But instead of losing it, I just keep thinking things like "I wonder if I could get Randy to buy me a shirt". I'm freaked out that I'm not freaked out."

Ken frowned. "That... kind of makes sense." He didn't want to admit it, but he found he didn't really care if the other two flirted away, as long as it didn't get in the way of his own goals. He'd always considered himself a practical person, and flirting with boys suddenly seemed like a waste of time instead of something he was inherently opposed to. If I'm gonna date anyone, I want to get to know them first.

Suddenly things started clicking into place. John, the immature macho man became an immature girly girl. Jeff, the manipulator, became one of those flirty girls who just wanted the boys to buy her stuff. And Paul...

Ken glanced at Paul, uncomfortably hiding in her sweater and hair. "And Paula? I mean Paul...a. Dammit, I can't say the other name. How do you feel?"

Paul squirmed nervously at all the eyes on her. "I-I don't know. I used to be comfortable around Randy b-but now..."

A blush covered her cheeks.

Jeff glanced from person to person. "Well this is bad, right?"

"But kinda cool, huh?" John was fussing with Jordan's hair, already looking and posing at the camera in her phone. "I mean, how often do four studly boys become four hot-to-trot girls?"

"Are you serious, girl?" Ken didn't even seem phased at the slip of the tongue. "We need to find a solution, ASAP. Or do you want to be stuck like this forever?"

"Do you really mind?"

Ken paused, before shaking his head. "No, and that's what worries me!"

"Well, maybe it's not so bad." Jeff's little mind was spinning once again as a grin crawled up his face. "This can't be permanent, but the odds of this being a first-time thing are pretty slim too. Girls must come out of that ride all the time. But the lack of complaints must mean everyone turns back to normal eventually."

"M-maybe they stop complaining because of their minds getting... frazzled?" Paul fussed.

"And yet no reports of missing persons as Disney World? Randy obviously remembered us, so clearly our lives haven't changed."

Ken pinched the bridge of her nose. "What the hell are you suggesting this time, Jenny? Jenny. Dammit."

Jeff grinned and wrapped an arm around her compatriots. "I'm saying, girls, that we have a rare opportunity to enjoy ourselves as completely new people at the happiest place on earth. No one knows who we are and, clearly, there's no way this can last forever. So why not embrace our feminine beauty and enjoy it while it lasts."

Ken groaned as John squealed in delight. "You're insane."

"I'm serious, I think we're all quite stunning beauties."

Ken wanted to protest but she had to admit, she was genuinely stunned and flattered by the compliment. Despite herself, she was getting convinced. Paula wasn't much better, a red blush covering her face.

"O-oh no Jenny, there's no way I could match how you and Jordan look...."

John pointed to Paul. "Ohhhh, at the very least we have to spend some time convincing our sweet little chipmunk how cute she is! She's sooooooo adorable!"

Ken struggled to regain her composure as Paula was reduced to stammers and blushing. "Okay, we'll put it to a vote. If we get a 50/50 split, we'll split into two groups and do... whatever works for them."

Jeff grinned. "Now you're speaking my language."

"Alright. Who's in favor of what?"
111133.title: The girls pull themselves away from Randy

choices: The girls go on thrill ride
The girls go on something relaxing
1111331.content:
Ken should have expected this. The signs were pointed to this horrible reality. But still, she was utterly disappointed to see Paul raise her hand in favor of "fun".

"Come on, really?"

"W-well..." she twisted her sweater around in a nervous fit. "It really makes sense a-and I don't want to disappoint Jenny and Jordan. And our parents spent so much money to get us here in the first place..."

"Yeah Kendra!" John was so very very smug. "Don't you appreciate your parents?"

"What are you- of course I-"

"Now girls," Jeff clucked a tongue cheekily. "We've all learned a lesson about appreciating things in life. There's no need to waste time when there's so much fun to appreciate around us."

"But I wasn't-"

"Oooh, ooh!" John hopped up and down excitedly. "I want to go on a coaster! Like Thunder Mountain or Space Mountain or Splash Mountain or Mine Cart Mountain!"

"The Snow White ride's not called-"

"Erm... can't we go on something more relaxing?" Paul would really prefer something calm, like Dumbo or the Carousel of Progress.

"Come on girls," Jeff taking charge again. "We need to do something we can't do as boys! Meet people! See the shopping scene! Something fun and cute and deeelightful in every way!"

Ken was sure the world was spinning all around her. They were all just too wild and excitable for her to keep up. No wonder she lost the vote.
1111331.title: The girls vote to have fun

choices: Ken gives in more to the inner Kendra
Ken struggles and tries something tamer
Ken resists and tries to leave
11113313.content:
Ken had to admit, she was kind of enjoying herself. Sure, she was still panicking a little, but there was something enjoyable in just touring the park. The park was designed for comfort, after all, and it was hard to deny that she was getting comfortable.

And as stranger as it was to admit, there was something... nice about doing the girly things Jenny and Jordan wanted them to do. It wasn't quite familiar but it felt like returning to something natural.

Which was why she could only smile as Jenny and Jordan searched through all the dresses at the Castle Couture shop.

"Awwwww these are all so cute!" Jordan squeed. "Look at how many classic dresses they have!"

"I know," Jenny gushed. "If I was a little girl, I bet I would have been all over that Bibidi Bobbity Boutique too!"

Ken rolled her eyes as even Paula started to fawn over the dresses. "Those aren't really efficient to walk in you know."

Jenny scoffed. "You're thinking too Kenny and not enough Kendra, honey."

"I'm far enough Kendra as I am, thanks."

"None of that!" Jordan pointed a finger right at Ken's nose. "We're here to be our girl selves, so you gotta do it too! You can't just stand off to the sides."

Another eye roll. "Maybe I'm just not the type to turn my brain off."

"Erm... I don't know if that's what I'd call it...."

"Yeah, Paula's got a good point." Jordan made a rare attempt at thinking. "It's more like... relaxing. Letting yourself feel how fun it is to be hot as hell."

"I-I wouldn't go that far...!"

"Yeah yeah, it's more like..." Jenny paused, considering before eventually shrugging. "You just gotta lean into it. Do what feels right girl!"

Ken really couldn't believe his friends. They had to be deluded. "Riiiiiight. And how would you have me do that?"

They all pauses to think over this point.

"...What's your favorite Disney princess?"

"What?"

"I mean, we're all drawn to our favorites, right? Paula's practically drooling over the Snow White skirts."

A bright red appears on the sweater clad girl as she quickly shoved a dress back on the rack.

"And Jordan, lovely as ever?"

Jordan grinned as she lifted up a Jasmine ensemble. "That girl had every boy's eyes on her. You know what I'm going for."

Jenny snorted. "And me, well, I'm clearly an Ariel gal." And surprisingly, Jenny's focus was indeed on the human Ariel outfit, rather than the more suggestive mermaid outfit Ken expected. She couldn't help but guess that Jenny vastly preferred the part where Ariel didn't have to say a word to twirl a boy around her finger.

Jenny's arm of conspicuous manipulation curled around Ken's shoulder. "You're just so wound tight while we're exploring the amazing world of girlhood. Wouldn't you like to join us? C'mon, think about your fav princess."

Ken shook her head in disgust. She really didn't get these people at all. How could they just ignore where they came from? They couldn't mess around forever, even if it was a little entertaining. But the looks of her so-called friends were firm. Ken wasn't getting out of this without making a judgment call.

She glanced over the outfits bitterly. Snow White. Worked hard and then trusted a stranger and got poisoned for it. What an inspiring tale. Sleeping Beauty? Ugh. Gave into a spinning wheel curse and made the man go through a whole epic quest that she slept through. No thanks. Cinderella? Honestly, did that girl even want the prince? Ken always felt she just wanted to go to a swanky party and got caught up in a royal scandal. Mulan and Alice were alright, but they weren't princesses. Plus Mulan gave up the chance to run an army at the end! Thanks, but no thanks. Elsa? Yeah, freeze the world because you didn't learn how to communicate. Honestly, all these Disney princesses were absurd and they offended Ken's surprising new passion for a good female hero. She just couldn't understand the appeal at all for these-

Her eyes fell on a yellow dress. Belle's dress. Beauty's dress.

Logically, her mind screamed "no don't you dare. It's about Stockholm Syndrome for pete's sake!"

But she didn't think that was true at all anymore. The Beast and Belle genuinely bonded. It was only after he stopped being so rude that they began to fall in love, a fact she was suddenly intensely aware of. And Belle was smart, logical, like her. She and the Beast spent all that time together, learning about each other, bonding with each other. No nonsense whirlwind romance. A whole year of slow building, of rising love and affection. Belle wasn't like the other princesses. She was smart and clever and caring and sweet and she did everything she could to make her relationship with the Beast work.

Belle was Kendra's favorite. No question about it.

Kendra didn't even realize she was stroking the dress until three faces grinned at her with delight. Kendra's face turned bright red as she quickly hid her hands behind her back.

"What are you looking at?!"

Jenny grinned. "A girl who's found her first dress~"

Ken crossed her arms. "You're being ridiculous."

"Come ooooonnn, embrace it!" She forced Ken's face to look at the dress, letting the light of Kendra's secret passion shine right into her eyes. "Can't you feel the warm comfort radiating from it? Doesn't it just feel right to give in?"

She could imagine herself wearing it, spinning around in a ballroom, a handsome gentleman she had months to understand and trust in her arms.

"I-its just not practical."

"I doesn't have to be. It's for your pleasure."
11113313.title: The girls see the sights

choices: Ken insists they go to the ride
They go to the ride, but are interrupted
Ken relents and they go all around the shops
1111332.content:
Ken was 100% sure she was going to get a 50/50 split. Her and Paul would go solve the mystery while John and Jeff ran off to enjoy their day in the park.

So she was surprised to see Jenny raise a hand for solving the mystery along with herself and Paul.

"Wha- really?"

"Ab-so-lutely." Jeff's smile seemed devious. "We need to get back to our old selves, no fuss no muss."

John stomped a foot, completely livid. "But you just said...!"

Jeff entangled a hand in John's, patting the pouting girl comfortingly. "There there, we have to be responsible. Let's get you some ice cream and then we'll head out. Does that sound nice?"

"....yeah."

And the two girls wandered off to the front of the store as Ken and Paul looked on in confusion.

"...Well that was easier than I thought."

Paul was sure Jeff had something up her sleeve, even if she was currently wearing a sleeveless outfit. But before she could voice her concerns, she noticed another boy staring at her. The thoughts quickly zipped from her head as she hid before Ken in a panic.

In line for the Main Street ice cream, the two pary girls were in a fiercely hushed argument.

"I can't believe you wasted our chance to have fun! Now Kendra's gonna drag us to boring places to do boring people things! That's boring!"

"But we're doing it as a group," Jeff insisted harshly.

"A boring group!"

"A group that has to make group decisions. With all of us there, we can outnumber Kendra with votes and ideas. Get her distracted and confused by the sights and sounds!"

John scrunched up her Jordan face in confusion. "Which means...."

"Which means we can all have fun. And all it takes is a little smooth talking to throw Kendra off her game."

John's smile rose in understanding. "Which means she and Paula have to have fun too."

Jeff snapped her manicured finger. "Precisely." And in an instant, she shifted gears to flutter her eyelashes at the server and flirt her way into a free scoop.

Within minutes, the four were reunited by the Micky Mouse statue, licking their treats while Kendra examined the map with intense vigor.

"We should probably return to the original ride. That's where this whole mess started, maybe it can get us back on track."

Jeff and John shared a glance as they shifted to sit closer to Kendra.

"Well, we do need to be thorough."

"There's lots of places around the area to check out too."

"Who knows if there's a soda or something that's causing this."

"The ride could be a coincidence. The change could've been caused by anything."

"And we can't leave any stone unturned, can we?"

Ken glanced at the two demons on her shoulder in something of a wild confusion. They were doing something, she'd be burned too many times not to know, but they were also prying on her fussy nature. What if there was something they missed?
1111332.title: The girls vote to solve the mystery

choices: All four girls end up going in
11113321.content:
Ken closed the map decisively.

"We're starting at the ride. It's the only logical place to start."

The J Team groaned silently with their eyes.

"But what if-"

"No buts, come on, there's no use delaying."

And no matter what ride or shop they pointed to, Ken seemed determined to drag them back to that accursed Fantasyland ride. Even if they suddenly appreciated the other rides a lot more than they did as men, the duo certainly didn't want to go through the ride all over again. Not at the risk of losing this so soon.

Ken gestures to the entrance of the princess themed attraction. "Come on, get in."

"Now hold on." Jeff's sly Jenny mind was moving a thousand miles a minute. "How can we be sure this won't make things worse? If it can do this to us, who knows what it could do?"

Ken began to retort but paused. "...You don't know that."

"Neither do you! We don't know what we're messing with."

"Well, we have to try something!"

"Not at the risk of what I have left."

"W-why don't we draw straws?"

She squeaked as every eye turned to her.

"What." Hissed Jeff, eyes ablaze.

"W-well I just thought-"

"Well, don't think." Jeff crossed her arms. She didn't like chance. That was too far out of her control. "It's a waste of time."

Even John felt that went too far. "No, it's a great idea." She quickly pat Paul on the back. "It's only fair."

Ken nodded slowly. "Yeah, and it means someone will be keeping watch. We'll split into two this time."

Jeff grimaced. Her out voting gambit had been used against her and she wasn't particularly pleased to see it. But the game had gone the other way. She'd just have to find another opportunity.

"Fine. Let's do this thing."
11113321.title: Ken insists they go to the ride

111133212.content:
Jeff stared at her straw in utter disgust. She couldn't believe the utter luck of this whole mess. Not only did her gambit force them right towards the last place she wanted to be but she just had to draw one of the shortest straws of the batch.

"Well, those are the rules, Jen. Saddle on in there," Ken shrugged. Jeff knew she was living this up. This was punishment for getting further with Randy, she just knew it.

John was tearing up, her hands grabbing Jeff's in a panic. "I-it'll be okay! We won't lose you, right!"

"Yeah yeah, don't you fret," she waved a dismissive hand. "I'll come out just as stunning and hot-to-trot as ever."

And so she stomped into the ride once again, Paul trailing behind anxiously. The shyer girl couldn't help but notice with her newfound interest the details even in the lines to the ride.

The ride was like a carriage ride, where the girls stepped into the seats as animatronic horses guided them through a variety of Disney castles. Perky voices sang about wishing and finding true love.

Paul was much more enraptured than the previous trip through, but all Jeff could do was scowl. "You are enjoying this, aren't you?"

Paul jolted. "Wh-what?"

"Look at you. Enjoying this stupid kid ride." She sneered. "But it makes sense. You really haven't developed much, have you?"

The innuendo smacked Paula right in the head. "Wh-why does that matter..."

Jenny, and she was in pure, catty Jenny mode, leaned forward into the seat smugly. "Well, its obvious that you can't get any real man's attention. I mean, look at yourself. You're nothing but a little nerdy, disgusting, fat little mouse."

With each word, Paula felt herself retreat into the chair. She wasn't that big... her sweater just... made her look bad. Or maybe she made herself look bad. She wasn't a beauty like Jenny or Jordon, or even Kendra. She didn't feel she had to be, she was happy just being their friends. Even when she was Paul, she didn't mind not being the handsome piece of meat of the group. But Jenny made it so hard to like herself.

She started to tear up. "I-I don't understand...."

Jenny smirked again, ego stroked from her defeating another worm. "Its clear to me. You just can't stack up to a wonder like me. Few can."

Paula brushed away at her wet cheeks. "I.... I wish you were nicer." She didn't mean to say that out loud and immediately squeaked in alarm.

Jenny glared. "Well, I wish you weren't such a mousey little nitwit."

The magic of Walt Disney World was a curious thing. Wishes could be granted or ignored depending on a multitude of factors. A previous visit on a particularly magical ride could grant the wish of "hot girls" to four eager boys with little trouble. What could the magic change this time?
111133212.title: Paul and Jeff/Paula and Jenny

choices: Ken and Jordan recognize the duo as they are
1111332121.content:
Suddenly, Jenny and Paula felt quite strange. It was strange enough being girls, but this dizzy sense of confusion, this feeling of complete and total disconnection from their bodies was entirely new.

Jeff or Jenny or however she felt she wanted to be called could vaguely tell that something about her clothes and body was changing. Pieces of fabric were stretching to cover what was once seductively placed and possibly inappropriately shown curves. Her short shorts extended down her legs until the seam vanished and became a tasteful, shin-length dress.
1111332121.title: The wishes are granted

choices: Ken and Jordan recognize the duo as they are
Ken and Jordan are baffled by the changes
11113321211.content:
Suddenly, Jenny and Paula felt quite strange. It was strange enough being girls, but this dizzy sense of confusion, this feeling of complete and total disconnection from their bodies was entirely new.

Jeff or Jenny or however she felt she wanted to be called could vaguely tell that something about her clothes and body was changing. Pieces of fabric were stretching to cover what was once seductively placed and possibly inappropriately shown curves. Her short shorts extended down her legs until the seam vanished and became a tasteful, light blue, shin-length dress. Her tank top shifted into a bright blouse. And more noticeably, her hair cascaded downwards.

Paula felt quite the opposite. She felt like, somehow, she was growing, her hair shortening near the top of her head as her sweater all but vanished. Her own top hid a sports bra and her long pants now displayed a surprisingly fit pair of legs. Her size had increased at least a foot, towering over the smaller Jenny. Paula's fragile form had shifted entirely into an athletic amazon.

And suddenly the world came back into focus as the two blinked in confusion.

Jenny gasped in horror, delicate hands grasping her face. "Oh Paula! I'm so sorry!" Her voice was distinctly sing-song, each word almost like a comforting melody. "I shouldn't have said those horrible things! You are nothing but a sweet, wonderful girl and it was horrid, absolutely horrid of me to say otherwise."

Paula rubbed the back of her neck awkwardly. "Eh, no big fuss. Besides, yer talking to the toughest girl in school." She flexed an arm, a grin rising easily around her rough-and-tumble voice. "Nothing like being called "mousey" would ever get me down."

Jenny patted Paula's hand comfortingly. "Of course dear. Nonetheless, I insist on treating you to a meal after our excursion. Its only nice and proper to apologize for such rude behavior."

Paula shook her head in amusement. "Yer too sweet for your own good. I worry about ya. If any punks give you trouble-" and she demonstrated by slamming a fist into her palm. "I'll give 'em the old one-two."

Jenny giggled. "Oh, I don't need anything like that. All I need right now is to greet our friends with open arms."

Paula laughed a booming laugh. "Nothing wrong with that!"

And as soon as the carriages reached a halt, the tomboy and the Snow White-wannabe hopped out of the ride and back into the light.
11113321211.title: The wishes are granted redux

choices: Paula and Jenny still remember being boys
Paula and Jenny think they've always been girls
111133212112.content:
Jordan was uncomfortable. She was usually willing to go along with Jeff/Jenny's shenanigans without any troubles. It usually led to a lot of fun. But now? She was seriously worried about Paula. The girl was so shy and nervous, and Jenny so loud and demanding. The two of them alone would lead to insults and general cruelty. For as immature as Jordan (and John of course) could be, there was a distinct feeling of loyalty she felt to her friends.

"They'll be okay, right?"

Kendra glanced up from the map. "Huh? I mean, even if we're changed, we're safe. They'll come out alive."

Jordan crossed her arms and hummed to herself, keeping an eye on the ride. She didn't see them yet, but they should be coming out soon, ri-

"Oh dear friends! What a wonderful ride that was! Thank you for sending us on it!"

Jordan and Kendra blinked and stared at the new girls. One in a long, flowery dress with perfectly combed hair. Another in a jersey jacket and gym shorts. They didn't know them and yet they did.

Jordan squinted. "J-Jenny."

Jenny suddenly grabbed her hands. "Oh, dearest, I absolutely love what you've done with your hair! It's beautiful!"

In spite of herself, Jordan was pleased. "You really like it!"

"Heh. Look at the fashionistas." Paula nudged Kendra playfully as the smaller girl struggled to process this new influx on information.

"Paula?"
111133212112.title: Ken and Jordan are baffled by the changes

choices: Kendra and Jordan are forced onto the ride
The girls continue their tour through the park
1111332121121.content:
Paula grinned, flexing her pecs. "The one and only!"

Jordan and Kendra glanced between each other. "You guys seem... different."

"New and improved, you mean!"

"I must agree." Jenny clasped her hands together. "I feel so much more at peace now."

The world spiraled around Kendra, her legs wobbling. This was her fault. She sent them into that ride. And now... Jesus. Was there anything even left of her lifelong friends. "Oh... god. What have I done to you?!"

"W-we can fix this, right?" Jordan didn't like this. This wasn't fun or playful or anything. It was just weird and terrifying. "We can get them back to normal."

"Oh, but Jordan!" Jenny gasped. "I love being like this! Why, I could never be as happy as I am right now. I can hardly even imagine being a man. Can you imagine someone like me as a boy?" She spun around in a circle, showing off her dress with glee.

"She's got that right! Why, I could take on any boy at school now!" Paula pounded her hand into her fist. "No way the old me could handle the world like I can! So anxious all the time! It's like waking up from a bad dream!"

"A simply dreadfully long dream. Being a boy just seems impossible now. Their attitudes are often so, pardon the rudeness, inappropriate at times." Jenny paused, eyes glazing over. "I must admit though... perhaps there is a handsome prince in our class I've yet to meet. Someone who could really sweep me off my feet..."

"Ha! Doubtful any man can keep pace with me! It takes a lot to impress me!"

Kendra and Jordan could only watch in bafflement. Granted, they couldn't deny their own attraction here and there, but this was beyond the pale. Wasn't there something they could do to fix this?

But before they could consider options, their new friends quickly wrapped their arms around the other girls.

"Now, let's not dawdle!"

"Yeah! There's still lots of cool shit to see!"
1111332121121.title: Paula and Jenny still remember being boys

choices: Kendra and Jordan change into their new teen girl selves
They change into a mother/daughter duo
The ride stops, slowing down the power of the wish
11113321211211.content:
Before they could protest, the (relatively) unchanged girls found themselves plopped into the seats of the ride.

"Wait, what are you-"

"Trust us dears!"

"You'll be happier after your wishes come true!"

And soon, Kendra and Jordan were trapped in what might as well be the doom buggy, riding off to a doom of identity. They struggled against the bars, trying to unlock themselves from their seats.

"Oh my god we're doomed oh my god we're doomed oh my god we're doomed." Jordan, once fun-loving, was spiraling down the drain.

"C-come on, Jordan, there's got to be something! We can get out of this if we work together! We're not-"

Kendra was cut off by Jordan wrapping her arms around her friend. "It's all my fault! I'm sorry!"

"Wha- your fault? How is this your fault? I'm the one that sent them on this stupid thing!"

"No, it's all on me! Jenny and I were hoping we could get you to have more fun! But it all went wrong! I should've been more responsible!"

Kendra held her friend tight. "No, it's on me! If I wasn't a hardass, so serious all the time, maybe this all would've worn off! I should've been more easygoing and fun!"

The two apologized to each other over and over, continuing to insist things were their own fault and all the things about themselves they wished were different.

"I should've been smarter, more helpful, more loyal!"

"I should'be been more willing to try new things, to have fun with my friends!"

And both of them, holding close to each other, said at the same time: "I should have been better to you."
11113321211211.title: Kendra and Jordan are forced onto the ride

choices: The girls want to go out into the park
111133212112111.content:
"Can we grant that?" asked a spirit of Disney World. "They didn't wish!" "Hush child," said another. "They wanted something from the depths of their hearts. That's the purest kind of wish there is. Now everyone, get ready. They wanted to change their past. That's going to be tough, so stay strong!"

Jordan shrunk a little as her hair pulled itself into a ponytail. Her mind reeled as new information flooded into it. She could remember her time as John, but now she could remember another world where she had been Jordan. In that life, she was, if not a nerd, a smart girl. She didn't go in for competitions, but she loved helping her friends. She was kind of a group mom. Where John had contributed to whatever the group was doing by lightening the mood, Jordan was always dependable to pull her weight and then some, not to mention have some helpful information on whatever they were doing.

Ken, no, Kendra's brain felt like it was about to explode. She could remember going to different countries, eating food Ken had never tasted before. More importantly, she could feel her friends' influence on her. Her muscles toned as she remembered how she'd let Paula drag her to the gym and on runs. She noticed that she was now wearing a pink dress and smiled. Truth be told, she'd be more comfortable in shorts and a tank top, but Jenny had wanted to match, and besides, a dress wasn't so bad. She still had the Mario tattoo she got in Japan on a dare from Randy. Most importantly to her, she had her best friend Jordan at her side. Jordan and she had been through so much together, and she'd learned so much from her. They'd truly had a magical relationship together.

The world came back into focus as the two looked at each other. "Well then," said Jordan. "It looks like we've figured out how this ride works." "What do you mean?" "If you have the same memories that I do, you remember being more willing to try new things and to have fun, especially with your friends. I' know I remember being smarter and more helpful. God, I was the worst as John." "Don't say that! You were a wonderful man. A bit of a goofball, but everyone needs a goofball in their life!" "Fair enough. Anyway, I'll bet Paula wanted to be able to stand up for herself more. Couldn't say how Jen got to where she is. Maybe she asked to be more likable. At any rate, we all got what we wanted. This is a wishing tunnel! We became girls because we wanted to meet, ahem, 'hot chicks.' It certainly has a sense of irony. Anyway, now we know how to undo it!" "Oh, yeah, sure." "It's going to be tough getting the others to agree to it, but I think we could figure it out. I feel terrible for how I treated you." "I feel terrible too! Truth be told, I think that there's a lot of fun to be had in our situation!" "Really? I wasn't going to say anything but..." "I'll tell you what. Let's meet Paula and Jenny and make a new plan there." "Sounds like a plan!"

When they got out, Paul and Jeff rushed to meet them. "You look so beautiful, Kendra!" squealed Jeff. "You seem to truly carry yourself like a proper woman." "I kind of feel like one too," said Ken. "I'm glad we're all on the same page," said Paula. "Now what say we decide what to do next? This is a nice ride and all, but there's a whole park out there!"
111133212112111.title: Kendra and Jordan change into their new teen gi...

choices: A group of boys transform into Female Disney Villains
A group of boys transform into mothers
Another boy into Older Woman idea
1112.content: Here are a couple of options!

11121.content: Is that physically, mentally, or both?
11121.title: A group of boys transform into Female Disney Vi...

111213.content: Michael, Jeffery, Alex, Kenny, and Colin entered the Magic Kingdom as boys, but they were soon going to be female Disney villains in both mind and body. But how does this happen?
111213.title: Both

They are like Disney characters plopped into the real world
1112132.content: How about a protagonist? A Disney fan who is annoyed by their anti-Disney attitude and has the power to accomplish this?
1112132.title: Another reason they become Female Disney Villains

11121321.content: The boys were about to become real life versions of these Disney villains. They may not be wearing the exact costumes or have magical powers, but they were going to look as if Maleficent or Cruella or any of the other villains they become lived in the year 2014.
11121321.title: They are becoming 'real' versions of Di...

choices: The Protagonist Decides to Follow Them
The Protagonist Picks Them Off One by One
111213211.content:
Michael, Jeffery, Alex, Kenny, and Colin walked through Fantasyland. "Isn't there anything halfway decent to ride here? This is like all kiddie stuff," Alex complained.

"Well, there's that new roller coaster," Colin said.

There were three of them -- a sandy-haired boy wearing green swim trunks, a blond girl in pigtails wearing a pink Disney Princess-themed bathing suit, and a redheaded curly-haired girl wearing a light blue bathing suit. All of them were barefoot and running around playfully, acting their ages -- unlike his wife, a grown woman who was sounding like some preteen girl . . . and maybe even younger, based on the lisp she was using.

11122122122121112111221211.content:
Tom opened his mouth to ask why Amy was asking his permission to play with a group of eleven-year-old kids she had never met. She was a grown woman, after all, not a little girl. But instead other words came out.

         "All right, sweetie," he heard himself say. "But be sure to wear sunscreen. Mommy will kill me if I let you go off unprotected. And be careful," he added. "Don't expect to be able to do all the things the big kids can do. You're still just a little girl."

         "Okay, Tommy," said Amy, and she ran off with the energy of a young child and joined the other kids.

         When she was gone, Tom frowned. Other kids? Just a little girl? And who was Mommy? Why was he treating his wife as if she were his little sister, and he was some teenage kid?

3 years later

Jon (son) was cleaning out his closet and found his long missing disguise pen.

He decided to test it out, and see if it still worked.

Little did he understand that the pen was a tool fuelled by Jon (son)'s own imaginative power. That power had grown over time, and now the pen would create a disguise so perfect it would fool even Jon (son) himself.

"Disguise power, Change me into...

1112212311.content:
"Jon (son) are you cleaning your room like I asked?" Linda shouted from below.

"Mom.."Jon (son) started to say before covering his mouth quickly.

It was far too late as far as the pen was concern, Jon (son) started to feel the magical buildup come from the magical device. It felt a lot stronger then he remebered it being though. Jon (son) body started to gain a couple inches as it aged to thirty-six. His body starting to gain a much more mature curves, and his hair growing out softer and forming a ponytail. The hair started to turn into a dirty blonde coloration and his face structure changing it's structure to that of a more mature, but still rather attractive lady.

Then Jon (son) Cloting had started to change, his clothing morphing into a simple yellow blouse. Her blue jeans chaning colors to a rather subdue orange coloration. Jon (son) socks disappeared as her black uniform shoes changed into a pair of simple green pumps. A white frilly apron appeared and tied itself to Jon (son) waist, and a tasteful amount of makeup appeared on her face. Jon (son) looked in the mirror and saw she was an exact double of her mother. It was strange, the disguise pen was never this detailed with the transformation before.

Her thoughts were quickly disturbed when.....

11122123111.content:
“I’m headed to my pilates class. Young man, that room better be spotless when I get back.” Said the real Linda as she left—unaware of what just happened to Jon.

Jon (son) wasn’t hearing what Linda had said. She rushed to the mirror to look at herself.

The disguise pen has a way of subtly distorting peoples perceptions. Similar to how no one could tell Jon (son) and Sailor Moon were the same person. It caused peoples thoughts to shift away from any doubts about the costume disguise wearers identity.

She saw Linda Jones in the mirror.

She tried to tell herself it was a disguise. That didn’t make sense. If it were a disguise then that wouldn’t be Linda Jones in the mirror. It was Linda Jones. She reminded herself about the disguise pen. There was just one problem with that. If it were a disguise that wouldn’t be Linda Jones in the mirror.

She spent several minutes going through circular logic in her mind. It all curved back to the same point. Any argument that she was not Linda, was disputed by the simple logic that it absolutely was Linda she saw in the mirror.

"Oh, I've got something much better than a picture. I'm getting the feeling that there's a bit too much… good in this room right now. I aim to add a bit more evil to the proceedings."

"Go. NOW!" Helen made one final plea.

Although he and his family came to Walt Disney World from winning a contest, 14 year old Eli Gates wasn't exactly happy with the choice of which area of the park his family decided to stay in for the week; the Magic Kingdom. He would've been fine with staying at EPCOT or The Animal Kingdom, but to his misfortune, his family decided to stay at the Magic Kingdom, since his 11 year old sister, Kelly, was such a big fan of the Disney Princesses, whether it was the classics like Snow White, Aurora, & Cinderella, or the newest generation of Disney Princesses, like Rapunzel from Tangled, & Elsa and her sister Anna from Frozen.

On the end of the second day of vacation, Eli snuck out the suite his family was residing in, which was inside the iconic Cinderella Castle, wanting to give himself a breather, especially since this was when the Magic Kingdom was closed for the night. After wandering around the vacant streets of the Magic Kingdom, he accidentally stumbled upon the entrance to the wardrobe room, where the employees of Disney World would get in costume for some of the theme park's live shows.

However, just as he slowly walked among the rows of various Disney costumes, Eli accidentally tripped on something on the floor, just as he quickly catched himself from hitting the floor hard. From there, he quickly found out what exactly tripped him: Belle's golden yellow ball gown dress from Beauty & The Beast.

Although he wasn't exactly a fan of the Disney Princesses, Eli was secretly a big fan of Belle from Beauty & The Beast, since she was very intelligent for a Disney Princess, as well as being very confident and optimistic, along with not being concerned about her appearance or other's appearances, able to look past how people appear and into their hearts, not to mention being quite obstinate when it came to staying her points, upholding her opinions, and maintaining her ideas.

In a way, it very much reminded Eli of his own personality, which would explain why he liked Belle so much, since he didn't view women and other people as property. However, he wouldn't mind giving that jarhead Gaston "the finger" for being such a egotistical musclehead, which would pretty much put a smile on his face.

Wanting to give his favorite Disney Princess some respect, Eli slowly stood back up onto his feet and cautiously approached Belle's iconic dress, carefully cleaning it from any stains he unintentionally delivered onto the ball gown's pristine silky smooth cloth. Finally, after spending a few minutes of cleaning the dress, Eli hung the dress back up onto the rack it was displayed from, with a proud look on his face.

But then, just as he was about to head back out the way he came, Eli.....

This time he laughs and retorts with, "You may find it harder than you think. Don't think of this as a burden, but an opportunity. You are a princess. Money is not an obstacle. Your belief that I'd fall in love with a man and be stuck like this is another," He gets a surprised look and states, "My, what an oversight! I am over 5000 years old, so I do get forgetful." He snaps his fingers and vanishes. "Wow", you hear your daughter exclaim! You look down and see Emily has become olive complicated dark haired version of her previous self. She looks like a miniature five year old version of your current self. "I love it. I look like you now mommy, but without boobs", she shouts! You turn red and whisper, "Honey, don't shout, boobs." "Sorry, mommy", she replies just as the first fireworks go off. You sigh and think, "Three days stuck like this. Well, sure beats permanent. It's all for Emily though, so it's worth it. I'd do anything for her." Something about this thought triggers an uneasy feeling, but you shrug it off. You're certain you can make it three days without falling in love with another man. The walk into Magic Kingdom was tense for Daniel and Mike.
Many things were swirling through their head, but one thing seemed to stick.
"I like him," Daniel thought and turned his attention to his friend. "But does he like me?"
Currently, Mike was staring off into space.
"Should I tell him?" Mike thought and tried not to look towards his friend. "Does he feel the same as me?"
The next couple minutes were torturous, with the two having to wait in line for their tickets. When the time came though, they handed over their money and got their tickets.
But the moment they stepped through the gates inside, something felt different. Neither man could figure out what exactly, but it felt nice.
"Where do you want to go?" Mike inquired.
"I was thinking..." Daniel answered back.

"Works for me." Mike answered back and the two headed off.
The Magic Kingdom had been open for an hour or two, but seemed a bit empty at the moment. Not that either boy really seemed to care at this particular moment. It just meant that they would get on the rides all the more faster.
The walk to the castle was brisk, leaving both of them with little time to dwell on things. But when they stepped into the castle, something felt... off. Maybe it was the relative darkness, or maybe it was the lack of staff within the general vicinity.
"What do you think we should do?" Daniel remarked, only for his gaze to focus on a far-off object in the distance. It was a pair of glass slippers, the sort that Cinderella would usually wear. "Uh..."

1113322221.content:
Nick sighed. He couldn't believe he was here.

He, alongside Tim, Josh, and Kevin, were walking along Main Street here in The Magic Kingdom, the supposed happiest place on earth. It was a surprise from Nick's aunt for his birthday. He had personally wanted to go to some beach somewhere soak in some rays and see some girls. But this wasn't the worst thing in the world. At least he was with his friends.

His friends that didn't particularly seem to want to be here.

"Come on, Nick, What is there even here to do?" Kevin asked, looking at a map.

"There's some roller coasters!" Nick said, defending himself.

"None with loops, though." Josh added.

"Hey, Space Mountain has a cool look." Tim said. He was sort of on Nick's side here. He wanted to make something out of this trip.

"Sure, and after Space Mountain, we can make sure to hit the goddamn Hall of Presidents." Kevin said, shaking his head.

"Why did we come here? Couldn't go to the park with Tower of Terror? Or that cool Avatar stuff?" Josh asked.

"We'll get there eventually." Nick said. "My aunt gave us a full week here. We can't just do that stuff over and over again."

"So we have to do all the kid stuff first." Kevin retorted.

"You didn't have to come." Nick said.

"And not take a week of school off? Please." Kevin said.

"Look, let's just check some stuff out, maybe we'll get a kick out of Winnie the Pooh. I dunno." Tim said.

"Sure. Like we can enjoy this Disney stuff." Josh retorted.

Nick sighed again. He just wished he and his friends could really enjoy this place, instead of just arguing about it.

1121.content:
"I told you we should have got here earlier. I told you!" Emma Young yelled to her teenage boyfriend, Patrick Manfield.

"Will you shut up for just a minute? I didn't even want to come here in the first place. Disney World is for, like, three year olds. Not for 17 year olds like us." Patrick quipped as he studied his map.

"I just thought it would be a nice, fun day." Emma said, gritted through her teeth. She wanted to punch him right now. People were staring. "And besides, a lot of old people like this park. It's been around a long time, you know."

"Yeah. It's old, and ancient, and out of touch with what's cool." Patrick said.

"Just like this relationship." Emma muttered under her breath.

Just one year ago, Emma and Patrick seemed like the perfect couple. Emma couldn't remember a happier time her, or for Patrick. They had known each other since their youth, and had decided to start dating at the beginning of high school. And it was great. But recently, the magic is gone so to speak. They can't help but see each other as stupid, or silly, and they are constantly bickering. Both of them want to regain the spark they had back in the beginning, and there have been points where it's calmed down. But right now, the bickering seems to be at an all time high.

Emma suggested they take a day at Disney World, which was only 40 minutes from their high school, in order to get away from the pressures of high school. In order to relax. But right now, it didn't seem to be working. Emma felt like this could be the end. She couldn't break up with someone at Disney World, could she.

"Oh, I just wish Patrick and I could be together forever." Emma said.

If there were any place that wish could come true, it would be here.

She turned to Patrick.

"OK. Fine. Let's have fun." said Patrick, defeated. "Where should we go first?"

Emma wanted to go to Fantasyland. But she knew Patrick would never go for it.

1122.content:
"Come along," Nicole Jacobs said. Nicole was a career woman. She'd had her first and only child after she'd gotten a big promotion at work. It was like checking off a box on a list.

Abigail, Abby to her friends, followed her. She was a perky little girl with endless energy and a big imagination.

Nicole held up her photocopied pages from the Unofficial Guide to Walt Disney World...a plan to see as many rides in as short a space of time as possible. Which rides to get FastPass for, what order, time of day... The manager in her had somehow found a way to take the spontaneity out of the most magical place on Earth.

This was a sharp contrast to the little girl, who was the exact opposite of her. She wanted to have a good time, maybe meet a few princesses. But, she didn't care where she was going. She just wanted to have fun.

They rushed along Main Street USA toward Cinderella's castle. Abby pulled away for a moment.

"Abby...don't wander off...we have a lot to see."

"I want to see the statue," she said, looking up at the status of Walt Disney, smiling, holding Mickey's hand in one hand, and gesturing excitedly with the other.

"That's Walt Disney," Nicole said. "He founded Disney...and built this whole park."

Abby looked at the statue in wonder at the man who created this magical place. Then she felt her mother's hand on her arm. It was time to move on. "Mr. Disney," she thought, as if praying to a higher power, "I wish my mommy would forget about grownup stuff so she could enjoy this place you built."

"Abby...don't dawdle...it's just a statue..."

1122121112112111111112112121213.content:
"I'm Abigail Jacobs and this is my daughter, Nicole," Nicole's daughter rather proudly stated to the man with a charming amount of stubble around his face.

The once grown woman Nicole finally snapped at that moment, the full realization dawning on her as she looked up at Abby who now had a more luscious and curvy body than she ever had as a grown-up. Nicole was now just a little flat-chested girl, dressed innocuously in a girl's skirt with a light blue Frozen shirt branded with Elsa on the front.

When she went to rubbed her tear stained eyes in confusion, she unexpectedly brushed the side of her brunette hair which she now discovered was in pigtails. Rubbing away with the distant hope of everything going back to normal she opened her eyes again to look in awe at her daughter. Abigail was now a pretty woman whose blonde hair was now neatly tied in a mature ponytail. Besides her simple pair of woman's shorts, she was also wearing a Frozen shirt but with Anna branded on the front instead.

Nicole was perplexed, how did this happen? She was the mommy......but now Abby was? That didn't make any sense, she was the one that had taken Abby to Disney World not the the other way around.

"Well it's nice to meet you two," Derek cut into her thoughts as he turned and looked down on her. "It looks like little Nicole has collected herself from the harrowing experience well enough."

Bitterly, Nicole was going to let this man have it but to her dismay it all came out in a whine, "I'm a BIG girl!"

"Well I can see that clear as day!" Derek joked with her.

"No!" Nicole yelled "Abby's the little girl not me!"

Nicole instinctively turned to the woman who held her little hand for approval but only saw a wave of red flash across Abby's face.

"Nicole. No one has called me Abby ever since I was your age little one," Abigail stressed the last two words as she talked down to her. "You take playing house way too seriously sometimes."

Derek hand waved the drama away with a hearty laugh, "Let the girl play house, It's the Magic Kingdom after all! I know my little guy here was just whining about me calling him Christoper like he's a grown-up or something!"

With a shock little Nicole turned wide eyed to the little boy standing across from her who wore a red Cars shirt. The blond hair boy was of a similar age to Nicole if not a bit younger, Nicole could have never imagined that he had ever been a grown man before. His boyish features and attitude hide any hint that he was anything more than a cute kid enjoying Disney World with his daddy. Was that what she looked like with Abby being her mommy now? She found that thought more cute and comforting than distressing which only then worried her.

Just as the two adults turned children locked eyes with each other the overhead speakers drowned anything she could have said to her compatriot in a spooky ghostly voice, "Right this way to the Boarding Area."

Derek winked at her mommy while he motioned for little Chris to take his firm hand to move forward with the group of tourists around them.

Feeling a similar force from her grown daughter move her forward little Nicole wondered what she should do.
1122121112112111111112112121213.title: The Fright of a Shock!

choices: Take her mommy's words to heart. She should just relax and enjoy the ride.
Nicole braces herself for the ride. Maybe if she thinks big girl thoughts.......
11221211121121111111121121212131.content:
Nicole was just a stubborn as a child as she was an officer manager. She hated when things didn't go her way and little Nicole's predicament was surely matching her former adult life. Here she was, a woman turned into a little girl, and she had no idea how she was even regressed in the first place. She felt so silly, childish for not even picking up on her dramatic transformation in age. Some part of her in her also worried for her little Abby who had seemingly, unbeknownst to either of them, taken over Nicole's former role.

Something in Chris' eyes told her he had answers, at least more than she had. If she could just...slip....free from her mommy's grasp she could get to Chris and quietly ask him what's happening before Abigail found her.

She deftly relaxed her fingers from her mother's hand and quietly sneaked away into the crowd ahead of them. Among the forest of adults and bigger kids, Nicole's short height of 42 inches came fully into effect. Abby had been 5 years old after all, did that really mean she was 5 too? Passing by a group of elementary school aged sisters that dwarfed her in size, that seemed likely to little Nicole.

Nicole Jacobs had gone from a successful career woman to a silly little kindergartner. This was Abby's life not hers, she felt like a bad girl stealing her own daughter's youth from right under her and that idea excited the woman turned girl in a way that frightened her more than the scary sounds and ghosts of the Haunted Mansion did.

Finally she found Chris, she quietly tapped his shoulder to draw his attention away from his daddy.

The boy was adorable, Chris was the kind of little boy she wanted to raise someday. His bright blond hair still bowled around his cute dimpled face but his green eyes betrayed that a semblance of a man inhabited the young boy's body.

'You too?" Chris whispered.

"Were you Derek's daddy?" She asked in a hush tone.

Chris nodded, "I was Derek's age and he was my age."

"Same." Nicole told him, "When did you switch ages?"

Chris seemed just as confused as she was, "Didn't it happen during the rides?"

"NICOLE!!!!!" Abigail yelled over the crowd, instantly dispelling the enchanted atmosphere for the crowd.

"You're in big trouble." Chris said in a bit of a loud taunt before realizing how childish that made him sound to own his embarrassment.

This caught the attention of Chris' son turned father who looked down onto the regressed woman, "My, my, Nicole I thought I would see you again."

Nicole pouted, "I'm sorry Mr. Derek."

Derek smiled, "For what? I should be saying sorry. I'm so jealous my little baby boy is more popular with the ladies than me."

This put a grin across little Chris' flushed face. Just like with Nicole, it was clear that Chris was begrudgingly enjoying being treated like a little boy by his own son. The role reversal was more intoxicating to either of them than any amount of alcohol could have possibly been to them in their old lives as grown-ups.

Derek, ignoring either of their reactions, called out to Nicole's mommy, "Abby! I caught Nicole over here!"

"Oh thank god!" Abigail said with relief as she approached them before addressing Nicole, "Baby why did you leave mommy's side?"

"Oh come on Abby." Derek winked at her again, "I think we're both old enough to know what's happening here."

Abigail smiled despite her obvious frustration but before any of them could say anything to one another the ride attendant spoke to them "Are you four together?"

Derek made a sly grin to Chris and Nicole before looking to Abigail, seemingly allowing the woman to give the final say.

"Yes, I do believe we are." Abigail said hesitantly, "Can we fit together in a single car?"

The ride attendant looked nonchalant, "With how little your kids are? Not a problem if they sit in your laps."

Chris and Nicole both shared a bewildered look upon their regressed faces. Not in her wildest dreams did Nicole think she would be sitting comfortably upon the lap of her own little Abby. Chris' new daddy took initiative as the car was opened for the group and picked up up the once fully grown man easily and carried the little boy into the far end of the bench before sitting him firmly over his lap. Chris' little legs dangled innocently over the car's floor. Nicole could hardly see his reaction before Abigail walked past Nicole and sat herself in nearest end of the car's bench.

She patted the top of her curvy thighs innocently to the once full grown woman, "Come on Nicole! Come sit on mommy's lap!"

Feeling the pressure of the queue behind her, Nicole stepped into the car and was quickly lifted onto Abigail's lap. With her little legs dangling over the bench and her back comfortably relaxed against Abigail's big boobies, little Nicole felt absolutely mesmerized by the sensations overwhelming her. Those feelings only went into overdrive when Abigail leaned in a gave her regressed mother a lovely long smooch across the young girl's earlobe before whispering, "I'll protect you Nicole, just enjoy the ride baby girl."

As the car's door closed and the ride officially began Nicole wondered if Abby was a better mommy than she ever was. She was hard-pressed to remember when she had ever held and cuddled with Abby like the grown up Abigail was doing with her right now. With the enchanting effects of the ride beginning to change her and Chris' mental state, she considered if there was any hope of resistance. She wanted to be a grown-up again, a manager with responsibilities, and most of all she wanted to be a better mommy to Abby.

Like Abigail was being to her.

Yet the return to childhood felt so appealing. She wanted to be a kid again, a kindergartner with no responsibilities, and most of all she thought that Abigail was the best mommy in the whole wide world.

With no escape possible, Nicole made her choice....
11221211121121111111121121212131.title: You Too?

"OK, well, since everything you want to do is most likely in the Fantasyland section, and this guide here says that most of these will get busier later in the day, we should go there now. I think we should start with a Fastpass to Peter Pan, since this says it is one of the most popular rides in the park…" Nicole dragged on.

At this point, Abby wasn't listening. She was in awe that she was going through Cinderella's castle. She looked at the amazing mosaics on the wall that told the story of Cinderella. She was taken aback by their beauty. Her appreciation for art, however, was quickly cut off by her mother.

"Come on now, Abigail. The longer we take, the later our Fastpass for Peter Pan will be." Nicole said, as she dragged Abby into Fantasyland.

Abby continued to hold her mother's hand as she looked around at the colors and wonders of Fantasyland. Even as she waited next to her mother while in line for Fastpasses, she looked across the way to the Rapunzel themed Bathrooms and it's a small world.

"There." Nicole said as she grabbed the two Fastpasses. "We'll come back here in an hour and a half, when out Fastpass is ready to go. Then we can get one for Winnie the Pooh right after. As for now… what do we do next…"

As the ride passed through the various countries of the world, Nicole began to feel less uncomfortable in the tiny boat. There seemed to be more leg room.

The last time they had measured Abby against a doorframe, she'd been three and a half feet tall, or 42 inches. Nicole had marked her own weight in comparison at five and a half feet, or 66 inches.

By the time they exited, Nicole felt rather different. She reached for Abby's hand as they exited. The proportions seemed wrong. She blinked a few times.

She remembered Abby as coming up to her waist. But now, she seemed to be much closer to Nicole's shoulder.

"Oh, and there are the rides but there is also so much else," added Lea.

Glancing down, she finally took in what she was wearing: mostly pink -- a Disney Princesses T-shirt, shorts, and flip-flops. When she reached to her head, she felt a pair of childish braids. choices: Damien looks for a park worker to help.

11233222222222122.content:
Damien had always been a bit of an ‘emo’ kid. He dressed all in black, dyed his hair, and had a few piercings too. Ever since his sisters were born, he had been pretty depressed. He hated how his parents never paid attention to him anymore, instead focusing on his siblings. He didn’t want to admit it, but he was jealous.

Still, despite his dark appearance, Damien did love Disney World. His parents had taken him several times many years ago, before his sisters were born, and it was his first time back since then, and his sisters first times at the park in the first place. He hated how his dad just kept videotaping their ecstatic reactions. It annoyed him, but he understood. His parents had new favorites now.

While he was there, he at least got to ride all his favorite rides. His mom had taken his sisters to go off and ride more kid-friendly ones, leaving just Damien and his dad. Even though he pretended to be moody at having to be babysat, he secretly enjoyed being able to spend some time with him. This was his first time since he was a kid that his dad was alone with him.

Together they rode on Space Mountain. Damien had so much fun on it, and was so excited about trying out the rest of the park, he hadn’t noticed that he was a bit shorter and some of his facial hair had disappeared. He didn’t notice that his most recent piercing, which he got in July, seemed to vanish. He felt a bit strange, but brushed it of as motion sickness as he dragged his dad off to more exciting rides.

Next they rode on Splash Mountain, then Big Thunder Mountain, then the Peter Pan ride. Damien was having so much fun; he hadn’t noticed he regressed back to 12. He felt a little more energetic now, and a bit shorter, but it didn’t bother him for some reason. His clothes were feeling bigger too.

After the Seven Dwarves Mine Train and the Barnstormer, Damien felt much more happier and more vigorous than ever. He actually hadn’t felt like this in a long time. His clothes definitely felt looser though. Did he lose weight? “Hey dad?” Damien asked his father, who was walking with him, “Do I look… smaller, to you?” His father looked at him, “Hmmm… Not really. You look as chubby as always.”. That made him feel better. Wait, chubby?

Last time Damien checked, he was pretty thin. When he went through puberty, he had lost a lot of his ‘baby fat’, becoming lean and, in his own opinion, quite handsome. He looked down at himself and noticed that he was pretty pudgy, this was probably the only reason his clothes still barely fit him because his usual S clothes would be considered an XL by kids standards. And he was definitely shorter. Damien froze as he looked at himself. “Uhh, dad, can I please go to the bathroom?”

“By yourself?” Samuel laughed. Damien was confused but nodded awkwardly. “Alright. I’ll wait outside.” Damien thought it was odd how clingy his dad seemed. He liked the attention, but was this really the place for it? Regardless, he rushed into the bathroom and looked in the mirror.

Sure enough, he was definitely younger. He looked about 10 years old now, to his shock. His black hair had reverted to its natural brown color and was much shorter now, looking like a typical tween haircut. All of his piercings were gone. The biggest difference was that he seemed to gain back all the weight he had lost during puberty, and was now a chubby, stocky 10-year-old boy.

“What the heck?!” He gasped. For some reason his mouth had automatically corrected ‘hell’ to ‘heck’, and his voice was higher. He poked his cheeks in disbelief, before rolling up his shirt and playing with his tummy. “How did this happen?” He wondered aloud. He wasn’t sure if he liked being this young or not. Worst of all, could he change back?

What was still the same were his clothes, which hung baggily around him. His black shirt and ripped up jeans were loose, and hung around his waist exposing his boxers, but still the same, but they still felt awkward to wear. As Damien wished that his clothes fit a bit better to his big boy size, they suddenly started to shift before his eyes, shrinking and changing color. His shirt turned red as the Avengers logo and colorful cartoon versions of the heroes suddenly appeared in the middle of it, while his pants turned dark blue and shrank into shorts. He could feel his boxers turning into briefs, which he could see were decorated with pictures of Captain America. Finally, his plain, dark boots shrank to Velcro-strapped red and white ones with what appeared to be lights in the soles.

He now looked like an average 10-year-old boy. He stared at himself in the mirror. What was he going to do now?
11233222222222122.title: From Emo Teen To Chubby Kid
