"Come one, come on, lets get going!" Carl Raymond yelled, as his group exited The Land section of Future World and back into the sunny Florida day.

"Coming, Dad. Gezz, slow down!" yelled his young son, Peter.

Carl shook his head. He couldn't believe that he had gotten convinced that he should take this big a group to Disney World on vacation. Not only did he have to work with his wife, Linda, to pay attention to their two sons, Peter and Daniel, but now they also had to bring his 5 year old nephew, Nicholas Leifeld, and Peter's best friend, Ian Wendell.

"What do we want to do now?" Carl asked.

"Well, it is 11:30. The World Showcase is open. Let's go explore that." Linda said.

"Fine. Let's go." Carl said. Peter noticed that his dad wasn't having fun.

"Dad, are you OK?" Peter asked.

"Peter I'm just a little frustrated with having so much to pay attention to and take care of. I just want us to all be happy, and I'm trying my best."

"I wish we could all be happy too, daddy." Daniel said.

Carl tried to smile, but right now his frustrated emotions wouldn't allow him to. None of the family or friends realized that the magic in the Disney air was about to work its own machinations, and help everybody get their happiness...

The group arrived at the World Showcase entrance.
1211.title: A group of young boys become older women of dif...

choices: They head to the next country
12112.content:
"How about we go through Canada first and make our way around?" Linda suggested.

The boys nonchalantly agreed and Carl let out a small groan of acceptance. They started making towards the Canada Pavilion while Linda looked at her map to see what attractions it had. However, Peter was the first to point out something.

"How about we look at the gardens?" he suggested to everyone's wonderment.

"Are you sure?" Ian asked. "I really want to go see that movie-looking thing over there."

"Come on!" Peter wined back. "Can we at least look at it?"

Everyone else didn't feel much need to argue, so they just reluctantly agreed. As they walked over to the Victoria Gardens, Peter started to feel a bit weird. For some reason, he felt a little out of place with his current crowd. He was only ten, the second oldest of the bunch of children, yet he still felt way too old to be around them.

'Well, I am the only teenager out of everyone,' he reasoned to himself as his belief came to be true. His age grew all the way to sixteen and his body grew with. Where he was once 4'3'', he was now about 5'6'' and weighed enough to prove it. Strangely, his muscles didn't grow that much with him. Peter looked like a pretty weak teenage boy.

"So, this is the garden?" Daniel asked. "It's pretty, but I don't see much entertainment out of it."

"You'll understand when you're older," Peter laughed as he admired the imagery. He was never one to truly appreciate fine decorating, but the garden was looking rather beautiful to him. For the first time since they visited the resort, everything felt peaceful. Peter could even feel the wind blowing through his hair, though he didn't feel said hair lengthen to his back in wonderful volumes and didn't even notice it turning from a light blond to a very dark brown.

Before they knew it, Maria and Victor were past Italy and had made it to The American Adventure. Maria started looking around for her friends.

"Do you see them?" Victor asked, not really sure who they were looking for.

"Si. There they are. In front of the building right there."

Victor looked over and saw a older looking Mexican woman, a blonde woman with the top half of a woman and the bottom half of boy, a boy with long Black hair, and two adults wearing childish clothing

But Victor doesn't see anything wrong with it. Just as he didn't see anything wrong with Maria before.

"Are you ready to meet everyone?" Maria asked, her transformation now complete.

"You mean am I ready to meet your mother?" Victor asked.

"Si. I'm just nervous." Maria said.

"Don't be nervous. Just give me a good luck kiss." Victor said, leaning in.

Maria and Victor share a passionate kiss for a moment, before letting go.

"I love you." Victor said.

"I love you too." Said Maria

1213221.content: Aaron Channing, Joe O'Donnell, Matt Lesnick, Zachary Roman, a quartet of 15 year-olds, plus Zack's little brother, Brandon Roman, age 8?
1213221.title: Five boys into five women

choices: Zack's parents finally let them go alone
12132211.content:
"Brandon, would you hurry up?" Zack yelled at his little brother. Brandon was dawdling, watching some geese swim around the lake. He could see geese any day of the year, in any part of the country. For some reason, he waited until he was at Disney World to become fascinated by them.

Zachary Roman won a contest, granting him VIP passes to attend Walt Disney World for six days. He got to bring his family, plus three friends. It would have been the trip of a lifetime if not for Brandon. Brandon, being nearly half the age of the older boys, was a drag. On day one, he wanted to ride all the kiddie rides. They all had lines two hours long, and they ate up the entire day. On day two, they finally got to try Splash Mountain, but the final drop scared Brandon so bad, he had to go back to the hotel. Zack and his friends begged his parents to take Brandon, leaving them at the park, but they refused. Even a place like Disney World wasn't safe for four unsupervised boys.

It was now day five, and everybody was touring Epcot. They were stalled by Brandon on the bridge into the World Showcase; eleven pavilions decorated to emulate eleven different nations, all circling an artificial lake. It was a 1.2 mile walk through all eleven countries, not counting any visits to attractions, rides, shops, or performances. It would take several hours to see it all, and at Brandon's pace, they'd be lucky to see four.

"Happiest place on Earth, my butt," Matt said with a sneer.

"That's Disneyland," Joe said, correcting his friend. "Over in California. We're at Walt Disney World."

"Shut up, Joe. Nobody likes a know-it-all."

"Guys, c'mon," Aaron said, trying to stop the squabbling, "just try and have a good time."

"I'm sick of trying to have a good time! I want to actually have a good time." Matt said, his frustrations growing. "We only have, what, a day and a half left? What have we done so far? We've done a bunch of piddly baby crap."

Joe interjected. "I mean, it's a kid's amusement park. Most everything was designed for little kids."

Matt gnashed his teeth. "Joe, I swear to god, I will throw you over the railing and into the lake."

Aaron shook his head, "Zack, I'm not trying to dump on your brother, but could you please just ask your parents once more to let us go on our own?"

Joe nodded, "Yeah, I checked the park rules and everything, you only gotta be 14 to be unsupervised. We qualify for that."

Matt piped in. "They take Brandon, we have fun, I won't have to cram him into the overhead compartment on the flight home. Everybody wins."

Zack sighed, "Guys, I asked them five times since we walked through the front gate. They're not budging. They said if I asked one more time, they're leaving us at the hotel tomorrow and taking Brandon alone."

The boys all groaned. The entire vacation was like this. Everybody was at each other's throats. It was now day five of Zack's vacation, but Brandon had so far dictated everything they got to do, see, and experience. Zack wasn't happy. His friends weren't happy. And Brandon didn't mean it, but he knew he was making them unhappy. This made him unhappy, too.

There's an important rule at Disney World that isn't listed anywhere. It's not listed, but it's the most important rule at the park. And everybody must follow it. Simply, Nobody is allowed to be unhappy. Sometimes it's as simple as employees making the visitors smile, or giving them a free treat. Other times, as the boys were about to discover, this meant more drastic actions.
12132211.title: Fine, fine, fine. Just get to the TFs

121322111.content:
Brandon had overheard everything Zack and his friends said about him. If they all hated him so much, he wasn't going to bother them anymore. Brandon wandered off to see the rest of Epcot on his own.

With the four teenage boys squabbling, they failed to notice Brandon's departure. It wasn't until Zack's parents looked up from their park map that anyone noticed his absence.

Trying their best to remain calm, Brandon's mother went off to find a park employee to help search. His father orchestrated a plan.

"Okay boys, split up into pairs, fan out and try to find him. He couldn't have gotten far." A creeping smile gave away Zack's delight. "And remember, you're looking for Brandon. No rides. Text one of us when you find him." The boys all agreed, but silently, they all had the same idea. If they would happen to stumble upon Brandon, great. Until then, they had full freedom to roam around the park.

And so, Aaron paired off with Joe to search half of Epcot, while Zack paired off with Matt to search the other half. Surely, Brandon would be fine in Disney World of all places. In the meanwhile, they could have some fun. Somebody would eventually find him. There were thousands of cameras all over the park and hundreds of dedicated employees.

And soon, there would be five more.
121322111.title: Brandon wanders off

1213221111.content:
Matt and Zack took the right path into the World Showcase. They meandered around the Canadian pavilion for fifteen minutes, but didn't find Brandon anywhere. Not that Matt was actively helping.

"Come on, let's ditch and go on Test Track," Matt implored Zack.

"No, Matt, we promised my dad we'd at least try and look for Brandon."

"He'll be fine. He's at the world's biggest playground. He's probably having the time of his life. Let's go do something fun."

"Yeah, I know, he's probably fine, but we gotta at least try and find him. Let's at least stay at the World Showcase, all right?"

"Ugh, fine," Matt said, tucking his hair behind his ears. It had been a few weeks since his last haircut, but he didn't think it had been that long.

Matt was contemptuously silent as they wandered around the British pavilion. He didn't care about such... such... well, maybe he was just having a bad day. He was so concerned with Brandon and the five bad days at Disney, he never stopped to consider today was a brand new day.

Matt took another look around. And voila, the World Showcase wasn't so bad. The pavilion was nice, although a tad cliche. The facades of the buildings triggered a strange sense of deja vu. Why European cafes and promenades were registering such joie de vivre was uncertain. It's as though the theme park had carte blanche over what he considered the creme de la creme.

So many odd word choices, Matt thought to himself. He was feeling odd. It was his own brain, his own thoughts, but it wasn't his normal rationale. He shook his head in confusion, releasing his hair from behind his ears. His hair was indeed longer now. What's more, the deep brown locks seemed much lighter now, almost amber. Surely, just a mirage from la soleil et la chaleur.

"Matty?" asked Zack, not realizing he used such an effete nickname, "are you okay?"

"I don't know," Matty said. "I feel d'accord, mais... non, I'm okay." He corrected himself. Zack just shrugged off the gibberish, assuming it was more grousing about Brandon.

"Let's keep looking for Brandon," Zack said.

"Oui," said Matty.

"Yes, we. You're not worming your way out of this."

As they crossed the bridge into the French pavilion, Matty's shoes began to change. The tongue and laces of his sneakers wisped away with each step, leaving the top of his feet exposed. A few steps more, and his socks disappeared too. Had anyone cared to look at the young man's feet, they would have noticed he was wearing red, slip-on flats.
1213221111.title: Matt starts feeling funny

12132211111.content:
The French pavilion filled Matty with a sense of what could only be described as nostalgia. Something about it's simulated cobblestone streets and the fake Eiffel Tower made his heart swell with pride. Strange, as he had never left the United States in his life.

"It's tres belle, isn't it?" Matty asked Zack.

"Yeah, I guess so," Zack said, though he wasn't looking at the park. Something about his friend seemed strange. Not just his hair, not just his speech, but his appearance. His face looked different. A little older, as though he were in college, not high school. But his body remained unchanged, no taller, no more buff, and not hairier. If he was getting older, why didn't he look any more mannish? It must be some sort of side-effect from being tanned under the hot Florida sun, Zack reasoned.

"Ooh, regarde!" Matty ran up to a shop selling pastries and desserts. Zack couldn't help but smile. It was certainly a change from Matty's previously sullen demeanor. Maybe it was time for a little snack.

The two waited in line, sizing up the various options in the display case. Everything looked so good. Yet with the incredibly high theme park prices, not to mention the high fat and sugar content, they knew they could only afford one each.

Zack chose a chocolate eclair, mostly because it was the only one he could pronounce. Matty opted for a strawberry mille-feuille, which he was able to order with perfect affectation. When they received their desserts, Zack reached for his wallet, only to have his hand swatted away by Matty. He opened his wallet to produce a credit card. With a quick glance, Zack realized something was wrong with Matty's ID. It didn't look like any learner's permit he had ever seen before. It was all pink and purple, and the photo on it didn't look anything like Matty.

The pair found a table and began to dine. Zack, hungry from the anticipation, took one giant bite of his eclair. Matty held his layered pastry daintily between one finger and thumb. The little bite he took was still enough to make his eyes roll back in delight. He adjusted himself in his seat as his hips started ballooning out. With each bite, his rear end grew wider. Past 32 inches. Then 34. Finally, with one last sugary nibble, Matty's behind was an ample 36 inches. His pants accommodated his new wider physique, but Matty paid the changes no mind except for an occasional shift in his seat, whenever demanded by his growing derriere.

"Hey, Matty," Zach said, "you've got a little..." he motioned to his lips. Matty had a little strawberry drizzle still on his lips. Matty attempted to wipe it off, only to smear it.

"Better?" he asked. Zack shook his head. Matty tried again, vigorously wiping his mouth with his napkin, only to smear it further. Zack found it funny how bad a job he was doing. After a certain point, Matty's lips were completely covered. His mouth was a bright, glossy red. Zack lied and said he got it all.

Standing up from the table, Matty adjusted the hem of his shirt, trying to adjust to his new pear-shaped physique. His changes were becoming more pronounced and unmistakable. Somebody was about to notice things were amiss.
12132211111.title: Continue with Matty

choices: Maddy still knows a little English
121322111112.content:
Zack took the wax paper and napkins leftover from the snacks, dropping them in a nearby trash can. Walking back to the table, he was confused. The crowds were large, but he assumed Matty would hold onto the table a little longer. Instead there was a strange person sitting there. Zack could only see the back of her head, blonde hair down to her collar. There was no point bothering the stranger. Zack instead looked around for where Matty went.

"Pardon," a strange man said. He spoke with a thick French accent. "Eef ah could, a minute of your time, please?"

"Not now," Zack said.

The strange man held up his hand in defense. "Ah am a portrait arteest for ze park. Ah make peectures of ze guests. Eef you are interested, ah have made a portrait of you and your... Is she your mother? Your aunt?"

Zack looked at the man's picture. There was a caricature image of himself seated at the table. But the strange woman he was partnered with was a mystery. Who was that sitting across from Zack in the image? Certainly no one he had ever met before. Though her face did look somewhat familiar. Particularly the red lips.

Zack almost involuntarily turned his head to the strange lady at the table. She had turned around to eavesdrop on the conversation. "Ooh, tres bien," she said. The woman at the table looked exactly like the woman in the portrait. Except it wasn't a woman. Not yet, anyways. It was Matty.

Certain parts of his boyhood identity remained, such as his eyes and nose, but not much else was there. His hair was longer now, past his collar and honey blonde.. Any muscle definition he had was gone, leaving a willowy frame. His face was softer, his mannerisms were more delicate. He wasn't just turning into a girl, but a woman. How much further would this transformation go? How much of the original Matty was left?

Zack grabbed Matty's hand and pulled him out of the crowded cafe, looking for a more private area to discuss their situation. As he did, he felt Matty's soft, smaller hand. No teenage boy had hands like that. Zack could almost feel the pointed fingernails growing. Matty said something, possibly in protest or confusion, but Zack didn't listen. All he did hear was the portrait artist shouting as he left: "Eef you change your minds, preents are $25, available until ze park closes."

Outside, Zack backed Matty against a wall so that he could see the full effects of the transformation. He looked to be in his early thirties now. His square jaw was filed down into a diamond chin. His shorts were pulled up over his navel, splotchy in color between their original red color and their new royal blue. The legs were flaring out, like a pair of culottes. His tee shirt remained unchanged, but was now tucked in. He was definitely more woman than boy now.

"Maddy," Zack said, unaware of the shift in identity, "I need you to calm down. Something super weird is going on. Do you even recognize yourself right now?"

Physically breaking away from Zack's grip, Maddy looked down. To him, he looked the same. "J'ai l'air bien," he said, in a much higher voice. "Tu est complètement à l’ouest."

"Maddy, stop. You're speaking French. I can't even understand you."

"Qu'est-ce que c'est? Je ne parle pas français." Maddy placed his manicured hands on his enlarged hips, thrusting his chest forward in defiance. It was flat for now, but Zack feared it wouldn't be much longer. The u-neck was already starting to expand outward. He could see more of Maddy's shoulders and clavicle.

Maddy tapped his foot, waiting for a response from Zack. Zack continued staring, seeing the loose fitting tee become more snug with each passing second. The logo on the front was fading into nothingness. Zack stared in shock, not admiration. Not that Maddy could tell the difference. Despite having no breasts, Zack's prolonged, unapologetic gaze towards Maddy's chest was still rude. He slapped Zack in his face, swept his bangs out of his eyes, and stormed off.

"Américains..." he grumbled, walking off in a huff.
121322111112.title: Somebody else notices the boys

1213221111121.content:
In the large mass of park-goers, it was difficult to keep track of one person. Much less one person who's personage was changing. Zack shoved his way through throngs of families, around children, under balloons, trying his best to follow Maddy. The park was simply too big and there were too many people. Zack almost resorted to shaking down every blonde woman he saw. One of them had to be Maddy.

"Excuse-moi," came a voice behind him. "Are you lost?"

"Maddy?" Zack said with a shock.

"Can I 'elp you find your freends? Your familee?" Maddy's brain was being overridden with park protocol. Maddy wasn't just an adult. She wasn't just a woman. She was an ambassador of The Walt Disney Company. That meant being helpful and cheerful at all times. And this little boy seemed especially troubled.

Zack stood bewildered at the image before him. Gone was the muscle-bound hothead who had dreams of playing college football. In his place was a woman. She had breasts now. They weren't huge, but they were there. He tried not to stare. He couldn't risk Maddy storming off again. They were nestled quite cozily inside a white, form-fitting top. Little cap sleeves covered her shoulders, and a scoop necline gave them just enough air to breathe. It was Disney World, after all. Nothing tasteless allowed. Especially from the staff.

The skirt had billowed out, forming a nice bell shape. A sharp royal blue, vibrant and striking. The hem bounced playfully at the knee, sometimes catching the breeze of all the people walking by. It ended tapered at a slim, trim waist. Zack could see the indentation of her navel through the shirt's thin fabric. As they were speaking, her blonde hair was swept to the side, gathering together, forming a loose side-ponytail, draping casually over her right shoulder. The elastic band appeared from nothingness.

"Maddy, come on, man. Think. There's still got to be a little bit left of you in there."

"Ah am sorree, 'ave we met?" Maddy's brain was overwhelmed with memories, flooding out all images of Zack. She saw thousands of people every day. One particular park guest triggering this kind of emotional response was especially odd.

"You have to still be in there. We both flunked Mrs. Henderson's seventh grade math class and had to make it up in Summer School. Think back to last Halloween. We stayed up all night playing Nintendo. Think back to the hotel this morning. We all yelled at you for taking a twenty minute shower."

One half of Maddy wanted to pull away from the young man, obviously delirious from the sun. The other half was enraptured by his presence. What exactly was he saying that had her so bewitched?

Zack stared the woman in the eyes. Trying to find his lost friend. Maddy stared back, trying to find any sort of truth in his words. She knew it was nonsense; in Grade 7, she was living on another continent. This boy wasn't even born yet. And yet, she somehow needed to believe.

"...Zack?" she asked, almost trembling. "Ah do not know what ees--"

With a bright shimmer, Maddy's eyes shifted from their standard brown to a bright blue. Zack jumped back in shock at the sudden metamorphosis. Maddy blinked a few times, trying to regain her train of thought.

"What were you saying?" Zack asked. "Say it again. Say it, Maddy."

"I... I... Ah am sorree. Ah must retoorn to work." Maddy walked off in with an air of determination. She was heading somewhere specific. Somewhere she needed to be, and promptly. Zack followed her, occasionally calling her name, trying to rescue her once more. But to no avail. He wasn't sure whether Maddy was ignoring him, or completely unaware of his presence. Maddy wasn't sure, herself.

The two arrived at a little shop selling imported bottles of French wine. Maddy went inside, behind the counter. A work apron was there, waiting for her. She slipped it on, over her head. There, on one of the straps, was a nametag. "Madeleine," it read. She smiled a beaming, toothy smile. Her teeth were polished, gleaming, and perfect. She made small talk with the guests, helping them choose the proper vintage for their tastes. If they asked, she'd point them towards the restrooms or park attractions, knowing full well the layout of the park where she has worked for fifteen years. Sometimes they'd ask about her native France, and she would recount details of the small village she grew up in. It was the amiable hospitality and superb customer service that was expected of Walt Disney World.

Zack tried his best to get Madeleine's attention from the door. Another park employee prevented him from entering. An unaccompanied fifteen year-old wasn't permitted inside a store that primarily sold alcohol. It was Florida law. Twenty minutes ago, the clerk running the register was an unaccompanied fifteen year-old boy. Not that you could tell from looking at her.

He waited, hoping something would happen. Maybe Madeleine would remember who she once was. Maybe the transformation would reverse itself. But the longer Zack spent staring, the less likely such a miracle would occur. There would be time later to freak out, panic, and question what exactly had happened. For now, he still had to find Brandon.
1213221111121.title: Maddy still knows a little English

12132211111212.content: Do you want to stick with Zack, or see what Aaron and Joe are up to?
12132211111212.title: Another boy starts to change

121322111112122.content:
Aaron and Joe, still halfheartedly searching for Brandon, crossed the bridge into the next country. Aaron was taking in the sights. Joe was providing the commentary.

"Did you know that the intent of the World Showcase was to form governmental partnerships with their respective countries?" Joe asked. "The idea was, countries would pay for the development and maintenance of their pavilions. In exchange, they get to show everybody the beauty and culture of their country with a Disney seal of quality. And then after ten years, they could either continue the partnership or a new country could move in. But that idea was too complicated and fell through."

"Oh yeah, that's great Joe," Aaron said, half listening. The two were in the Japan pavilion now, and Aaron was entranced by the Taiko drummers. They were putting on quite an energetic presentation.

Joe adjusted the sit of his Hawaiian shirt. The sun was getting higher, and the temperatures were getting warmer. "Oh man, these guys are great," Joe said. "You know what's weird though? That despite the traditional clothes, choreographed Taiko drumming was invented in the 1950s? I think that's cool how much of Japanese culture is a hodgepodge of past and present. Plus the future, I guess. Gundam robots are cool."

Joe could have been reading off the cure for cancer. Aaron wasn't listening. He was too busy watching the drummers. He didn't even notice Joe starting to shrink. His clothes started tenting, just hanging off his body as the teenage boy shrank down to a mere 5'1".

"I mean, I like living in America, don't get me wrong," Joe said, "But if I could live anywhere else, I think it would probably be Japan. I've never really considered it before. I always assumed it would be Ireland because, y'know, I'm Irish and I wouldn't have to learn a new language. But nah, there's a healthy tech industry, beautiful landscapes, a world-class environmental initiative, not to mention the entertainment industry. Yeah, Japan would be great."

Aaron still wasn't listening. He blocked Joe out completely. As Joe continued speaking, realizing his words were falling on deaf ears, he turned his attention elsewhere. He didn't stop talking, no. Joe was a fount of knowledge. He liked sharing it, whether anyone wanted to hear or not. If Aaron didn't want to hear it, that was his loss.

"The Japanese don't even call their country Japan. They call it 'Nippon.' It's like when you use translation software online? And sometimes it works right, but sometimes it spits out gibberish. That's what happened. By the time westerners heard of the country, it got all muddled around, bouncing from language to language, turning from Nippon to Japan."

Joe was talking with his hands more than normal. He usually kept them shoved in the pockets of his shorts, but now it felt wrong somehow. He was now accenting his speech and his thoughts with gentle hand movements, as though he was trying to engage a crowd. Had his hands been less animated, perhaps Joe would notice his skin softening and his nails growing.

"Speaking of names, in Japan they don't have first names and last names. Well, I mean, they do, but not like we know them. The first name, the given name, comes last. The last name, the family name, comes first. Most Asian countries do that. Like for example, to the western world, I'm Joe O'Donnell. But in Japan, I'd be O'Donnell Joey. Though you'd still call me Joey like normal."

Aaron wouldn't normally call him Joey. Nobody had called him Joey since he was four years old. For some reason though, he could only think of himself as Joey. That was his name. It wasn't five seconds ago, but it was now. Just as his normally tousled, wavy hair existed five seconds ago, but was now becoming straight.
121322111112122.title: Joe knows a lot of stuff

1213221111121221.content:
"You see that building over there?" Joey asked. "The one the drummers are playing in front of? That's a scale replica of the Horyuji Temple. It was built in the 7th century. It's a world heritage site. The real one, I mean. This one here opened with the park. Although, it should be noted, the blue roof is an aesthetic choice made by Disney to make the building more eye-catching from a distance." Gesturing grandly at the tower, Joey's short sleeves began elongating, reaching down to his elbows. They flapped around as he gesticulated, but Joey ignored them.

He continued. "And it looks particularly nice against the Japanese maples. All the trees in the World Showcase are non-native to Florida, but instead representative of their respective countries. Our groundskeeping staff works extra hard to compensate for the change in climate and soil."

"Our staff?" Aaron asked.

"I mean the staff. The Epcot staff. I must have misspoke."

The drummers finished their show with a bow, and the crowd began to disperse. Most of the crowd, anyway. A small number of people surrounding Aaron and Joey stayed put. Aaron was slightly confused. Maybe there was another show starting? There didn't seem to be anybody coming onstage.

"Maybe we should get going," Aaron said.

"Yeah, you're right," Joey said. "There's lots more to see. For example, to our right is a replica of the ceremonial hall of the Imperial Palace.The coronation and ceremonial halls are two of several buildings on the castle grounds, the home of the Japanese Emperor since Tokyo became the nation's capital in 1868."

"Joey, did you Google all this or something?" For as long as Aaron had known Joey, he had been a brainiac. He knew all sorts of stuff, but most of it was surface level. The kind of things they would ask in Trivial Pursuit. Aaron didn't peg him as an expert in any specific area, least of all the history of Japanese architecture.

"Gee, I don't know. I watch a lot of game shows. I think it kind of snuck in," Joey explained with a smile. His skin looked different. Joey had always had rather fair skin, but now he was looking pale. Almost ivory.

Aaron shrugged it off. "Do you want to go into the palace? I don't know what's in there, but--" he stopped himself. Why even bother making an assumption when the facts were available. "You know exactly what's in there, don't you?"

"Oh yes," Joey said. "On the outside, the building resembles the Imperial Palace. On the inside, it is Mitsukoshi Department Store. There are many Japanese items available for sale inside. Let's take a look."

Aaron followed his friend as they walked towards the store. Looking up at the tall building, Aaron suddenly found himself staring directly into the sun. He had previously been in the shadow of a nearby tree. Now the sun hit his eyes almost directly. He blinked a few times, trying to recover. He saw a lot of spots, but through it all, he could have sworn he saw Joey's red shirt lighten in color to a hot magenta.
1213221111121221.title: Joey keeps talking

choices: Aaron waits out the ten minutes
12132211111212212.content:
As the boys stepped into Mitsukoshi Department Store, Joey's sleeves grew more, reaching down to his elbows. There was quite a bit of fabric on his arms now, and it was getting baggy and billowy. Every time Joey moved his hands around, a wave of silken material came surging along with it. He was afraid his sleeves would be snagged somewhere, or he would smack some poor stranger in the face. Joey made sure to use softer, slower gestures.

Joey gracefully gestured with his right hand, allowing the grandeur of the store to be admired. He felt almost like a hula dancer with the slow, purposeful motions. Likewise, Joey felt subconsciously obligated to keep his fingers connected, pointing with his full hand. He reasoned that some cultures considered pointing fingers to be rude, and since he was at a tourist hotspot with visitors from many different nations, he should be courteous. He had convinced himself that utilizing the Disney Point, used by all other park employees, was a completely voluntary action. He couldn't stop if he tried.

Joey smiled as he presented the shop's interior. "The Mitsukoshi Department Store is named after the oldest department store in the world, founded in 1673 in the city of Tokyo, then called 'Edo'."

Aaron was struck by the size of the complex. Disney World had no shortage of gift shops, but most sold souvenir clothes and plushies. This store was the size of a football field and had just about anything Japanese Aaron could imagine, short of Nissans and televisions.

"Hey, Joey," Aaron asked, "do you think my girlfriend would like a parasol or something?"

Joey stared ahead, almost indifferent to Aaron. "Take a moment to admire the wooden sculpture in the center of the store. It is a replica of the carved cypress statue from the original store. It represents the corporate motto, 'Service With Sincerity'."

"Yeah, that's great. But seriously, do you think she'd want a paper fan? Maybe one of those kitten statues with the raised paws?"

Joey, again, did not respond. "If you are of legal age, be certain to experience the saki bar near the rear of the building."

"Joey, man, would you knock it---" Aaron was about ready to smack his friend upside the head, when he noticed his red lips standing in stark contrast to his fair skin. His hair was inky black and starting to drop past his ears. The hem of his Hawaiian shirt was longer now, reaching down almost halfway to his knees. Had it not been so loose and flowing, he may have noticed the slimming of his waist or widened hips. What was happening?

Aaron stared at Joey, who seemed to be staring off at nobody in particular. More like he was observing the various shoppers as they milled around the store. Aaron realized they were the same people who were standing around them at the stage. Had they followed them both in? Seeing Joey undergoing some sort of identity crisis may have garnered some stares, but nobody seemed to be paying Joey any attention. And yet, they followed him all the same.

"Jori," Aaron said, oblivious to the shift in name, "what's with your... everything?"

"Prease, feer free to shop-u whire," Jori said, suddenly unable to pronounce their L's. "We wirr continue in ten minutes-u."

Jori returned to their silent observation of the store, hands neatly folded in front of them, crossed at the wrist. The pastel nail polish now matched the faint purple hue of Jori's shirt.
12132211111212212.title: Joey's kinda talking funny

choices: Freak out right in the open
121322111112122121.content:
Aaron always considered himself a peacemaker, never trying to raise trouble. Sure, Jori needed help, but this was a rather unfortunate and embarrassing problem. The fewer people who were aware of his plight, the better. How would Aaron even bring up the subject? 'Help, my friend is turning into an Asian lady'? Aaron would be locked up in the loony bin. Indeed, Aaron decided, a calm and patient approach would be best.

Ten minutes wouldn't be that long. It was enough time to work out a plan. Maybe even figure out what's going on. Maybe even reverse it. Aaron milled around the store, hopelessly looking for any clue to his friend's predicament (not that he would ever find any), occasionally glancing at Jori's hexed state. By now, Jori's shirt was hanging lower than his shorts. He could be walking around pantsless for all Aaron knew.

Perhaps Aaron was standing too far away, but the buttons on Jori's shirt seemed wrong. They were supposed to be fastened straight down from the neck, but they seemed angled now. They were going slantways, diagonally across the right breast. Had anyone noticed or cared besides Aaron, they would see Jori wearing a completely crooked and too long shirt. He looked like he was wearing some sort of tunic.

As the ten minutes expired, Aaron regrouped around Jori and the growingly familiar group of strangers. He was running out of time. Jori's face was was now sporting folds and lines near their eyes and cheeks. Aaron hesitated to call Jori old, but even with soft skin and a delicate frame, it was apparent Jori was no longer a high school student.

"Jori," said Aaron, trying to get his friend's attention.

"Kori, if you prease," Kori said with a smile befitting someone in the service industry. "You have question?"

"Yes!" Aaron said, trying not to scream. "Lots!"

"One rast stop-pu," Kori said. "Prease continue out-se door-eh, to-se lake-u." As Kori turned to exit the door, a sash gathered itself around their waist. Not that Aaron was looking specifically there, he knew with certainty Kori's tunic was hanging loose off their diminishing frame. But then, unless his eyes were deceiving him, a bright blue sash was now holding the tunic tight against a remarkably narrow waist. That sash couldn't just be fastening the rear, could it? No, it could not. But where did it come from, if not materializing as Kori turned? Aaron hoped this final stop would be a short one.

Kori led the group out to the fence surrounding the large torii gate at the lake's edge. "This gate is fashion after-se one found off-se coast of Itsukushima Isrand in southern Japan. Gates are common sight in Japan, usuarry seen at entrance to both Shinto and Buddhist shrines."

The buttons on Kori's tunic were gone now; compressed closed by the sash around their waist. Not even the waist, but under the breasts. And Kori certainly had breasts now. They were small, but they weren't hiding. The floral Hawaiian pattern of Kori's original shirt was still present, but the pattern's background was now a soft mauve, accented by deeper blues along the hems, matching the sash. It was clearly silk now, with a distinct sheen under the sun. As the sleeves and hem extended further one final time, Aaron realized his friend was sporting an elegant kimono. On anyone else, it would be lovely.

Kori continued their well-rehearsed dialogue on Japanese culture and architecture. No longer mere trivia, this was an expertly rehearsed speech. The facts were recited with the kind of presence and confidence that only comes from practice. And Kori had practiced it. Kori had delivered this speech seven times a day, five days a week, 50 weeks a year, for the last fourteen years. At least, that's how she and everyone at Disney remembered it.

Aaron had a history of tuning out Kori's many ramblings He was doing so now. Not that he was doing it for the same reason he normally would. Usually, Aaron was bored or disinterested. Now, Aaron was distracted, focusing on Kori's physical and mental changes. He wished he could focus. Even if it was a diminutive woman's voice with a strong Japanese accent, it could very well be the last time Aaron ever heard Kori speak.


Kori's wrapping up her speech. Aaron probably has time for one carefully worded question. Where does Aaron talk to her?
121322111112122121.title: Ten minutes-u later...

1213221111121221211.content:
The tour ended. After a few questions and a couple of photographs, the crowd dispersed. Kori paid Aaron no mind, assuming he lingered to further admire the surroundings. Kori's next tour started in 30 minutes. With nothing to do in the meanwhile, Kori headed back to the cast members area for a short break. Aaron would have none of that.

"Wait, stop, don't go," He asked the departing woman.

"So sorry, se tour is done," Kori said. "If you have more question, a new tour wirr begin soon. Haruki-san is very knowledgeabre about park-u."

"Kori, please. I don't know how much more of this I can take. Look at your clothes. Your body. Your face!" As Aaron pleaded with his friend, the last remnants of Kori's original form began to fade. Her eyebrows got thinner. Her nose became smaller. Her ears stuck out less, resting closer to the sides of her face.

"I... I do not understand..." Kori muttered, becoming slightly scared at the tall American boy. He was becoming louder, and more aggressive. Kori had, unfortunately, encountered many American men who acted like this. But none ever said the words he was saying. All the same, she hoped a security guard would intervene soon.

"You're one of my best friends," Aaron said, his hands folded in desperation. "Please tell me you're all right."

"I... I..." Kori's fear began to melt away as strangely familiar memories of Aaron began to float to the surface. She didn't know the boy. She couldn't recall a single moment they had ever been together. If she had a thousand guesses, she would never recall his last name. But she knew him. And that was enough. "I think I'm going to be fine, Aaron." She smiled. Not the ebulliant Disney employee smile, but a natural one. She breathed a contented sigh and closed her eyes.

Aaron didn't know what to do next. Kori seemed to remember a little bit. More than she had before. Was it over? Was she done, or was she changing back? Or would it start again? Kori closed her eyes in a moment of tranquility. They were the same eyes Joe had this morning. When she opened them again, the folds around her eyes were gone, leaving them in an unmistakable Asian shape, slightly upturned, and remarkably beautiful. There was nothing left of Joey in body or in mind.

She departed, walking back to the cast member's area. She had stopped for... something. She couldn't quite remember. An American boy wanted something? Yes, that was it. What was it? Something was right? No, more likely something was to the right. She must have been giving the boy directions somewhere. Most tourists need directions. Disney World is a big place.

Aaron was relieved his friend was safe, if not exactly present. But he was so close. Maybe he could try again. "Stop," he said chasing after her. "Joe, you love telling people things. You love answering questions. You can't resist. If you're still in there somewhere, you gotta answer me. Don't you know who you are?"

"Who I am?" she asked. What an odd question. Suddenly, it dawned on her. Of course! No wonder the poor boy was confused. She hadn't been wearing her name tag. Reaching into a pocket discreetly hidden on the kimono, she found the missing element. She was glad she could correct this mistake before a supervisor noticed. She was a dutiful employee of the park and hated getting into trouble. She affixed the name tag over her breast, showing it off so Aaron could clearly read it.

"Kaori!" Kaori read her name aloud with a smile. She posed, flashing a v-sign with her fingers, the way Japanese girls had done since she was a little girl. It was a little cliche, especially for a woman her age, but for whatever reason, the Americans really liked it. She typically posed this way whenever guests asked for photos.

Kaori smiled, knowing she helped this American boy, and in return, he helped her. She opened a door marked 'cast members only' and stepped inside, never to be seen again. Aaron simply saw the back of her lavender kimono and jet-black bob disappear as the door closed behind her. Aaron considered chasing after her, but no. Apart from getting tackled by park security, it would just be a waste of time. Joe was Kaori now. Aaron wouldn't be saving his friend, he would just be terrorizing a Japanese lady who couldn't recognize him any longer.

What would be the normal thing to do in this situation? Cry? Scream? Run? Curse? Aaron looked around at all the happy families and couples and tourists. They were all having fun. He didn't want to ruin their vacation. Not that he could if he decided to. Aaron couldn't process what he just experienced. He walked off, nowhere in particular, his mind free of all things. He couldn't understand it, so he just didn't think of it. But it was so crazy, he couldn't think of anything else. He just started walking, hoping things would start making sense again soon.
1213221111121221211.title: Freak out somewhere private

12132211111212212111.content:
Aaron stumbled around, aimless. What was he supposed to be doing? Where was he supposed to be going? It didn't matter. Nothing mattered. Nothing made sense. Happy people all around him, and he was in a lumbering, catatonic state.

"Aaron!" came a voice from behind him. "Aaron! Hold up, wait!" Zack jogged, closing the distance between he and his friend. Aaron continued walking.

Catching up to Aaron, Zack walked beside his friend. He was oblivious to Aaron's behavior. "Oh man," Zack said, "am I glad to see you. Something weird is happening. You would not believe what just happened to me and Matt."

"Joe's dead," Aaron said.

"Wait, what?"

"Joe's dead. Maybe. Kinda. I don't know."

"Aaron," Zack said, trying to wrestle control of the conversation, "you're not going to believe this. But Matt? He turned into another person!"

"Joe's gone. I didn't know what was happening. I didn't know how to stop it. I couldn't help. I couldn't save him. One minute he's there, the next, he's becoming a Japanese woman."

"Holy crap, you're kidding. That's what happened to Matt! He turned into a French lady. Right before my eyes! I couldn't believe it. I still can't believe it."

"They got Matt too? Oh no. Oh no, oh no. First Joe, now Matt?" Before Aaron was stunned. Now he was scared.

"Earth to Aaron," Zack said, "come in for a landing. I need you to focus here. We have to figure out what's happening. Two of our best friends turned into strange foreign ladies? We can't just go home and have them stay in Florida forever. I don't wanna have that conversation with their parents."

"What's going on, Zack? How is this happening? Is it something they did?"

"I don't know, but we gotta get outta here. If it happened to them, it could happen to us."

"What if it's happening to everyone? How many people could be changing? Is everyone at least staying human?" He pointed at a pair of squirrels running around the branches of a tree. "Those squirrels could be your parents! Hi Mister and Missus Roman," he said, waving.

"Knock it off!" Zack said, slapping his hand down. "Look, if we're gonna save Joe and Matt, we gotta figure out what's going on. But we can't do it here. We're not safe here."

"What should we do? Make a break for the hotel?"

"Maybe. First we should split up. We were all grouped up this morning, and were fine. Matt and Joe changed when they paired up with us, right? Being in pairs must be dangerous."

"Right. split up. Meet at the entrance. But, hey, Zack..."

"What?"

"Your parents are in a pair. I mean, assuming they're not..." he gestured back at the tree.

"My parents are not squirrels!" Zack shouted a little louder than he intended.

"As far you know."

"Look, you get to the front gate solo. I'll find my parents. My human parents. With any luck, they'll have found Brandon. Then we'll be a group of four. When we meet you at the front gate, we'll tell them what happened to Matt and Joe, and we'll all figure something out together."

"Right. Good luck, Zack."

"Good luck, Aaron."




The two boys will not be having good luck, at least from their perspective. Who's getting changed next?
12132211111212212111.title: Zack meets Aaron again

121322111112122121112.content: Let's let the two remaining teenagers sweat it out a little longer. Someone else needs to change first.
121322111112122121112.title: Someone else

choices: Brandon waits a bit longer in the security office
1213221111121221211121.content:
There were many exciting places to be in Disney World. Many things to do. Many things to see. People paid top dollar and waited in lines for hours to see the wonders that Disney World offered. Brandon was seeing none of that. He was in the least desirable place in the entire park. Brandon was in the security office.

The young boy sat with his hands folded in his lap. He didn't mean to cause any trouble. He didn't mean to cause any harm. All he wanted was to find his family. He heard his brother and his friends being mean, so he took off, running in shame. He realized that was a mistake. He didn't know what to do after that.

Alone in the Mexico pavilion, he took a ride on the Gran Fiesta Tour. Brandon's family and their search party couldn't locate the boy, hidden away on the enclosed dark ride. While the remaining park staff were informed to look for a young, lost boy matching Brandon's description, the Gran Fiesta Tour ride operators never considered Brandon to be that boy. One eight year-old looked indistinguishable from another, and Brandon did not appear to be lost. The ride operators assumed he belonged to the family either in front of him or behind him.

The ride made Brandon happy for a little while, but he was still an eight year-old lost child in a big, strange, unfamiliar place. He wanted to find his family. Being such a young age, Brandon was short in stature, easily intimidated, and didn't always think things through. There was no logical way to find his family amongst the thousands of strangers milling about. By his rational, he needed a better vantage point. And to get that, he needed to climb the giant Mayan pyramid sitting in the center of the pavilion.

This is when the security team found him. They immediately noticed an errant child climbing the structure despite the well-placed "Do Not Climb" signage surrounding the pyramid. They coaxed Brandon down, and quietly escorted him backstage, into the security office, all without disturbing the other park guests.

And so Brandon waited, sitting alone in the featureless detention room. If he was in trouble, he sure felt it. Was he going back to his parents? Back to the hotel? Was he kicked out of Disney World altogether? Goodness, was he under arrest? Brandon didn't know.

Normally, the security team who apprehended Brandon and the security team who were searching for Brandon would be in quick communication. Brandon's parents would be swiftly reunited with their child, politely reminded about stranger danger and park policies, and be sent on their way. The story would be a happy ending for Brandon then and there. Unfortunately, a technical glitch prevented the security staff's walkie-talkies from working properly. The problem was neither electrical or digital. It was caused by the same magical source that was turning boys into women. Brandon was left alone because Epcot needed Brandon alone. Epcot had plans for Brandon.
1213221111121221211121.title: Whatever happened to Brandon?

12132211111212212111211.content:
Time passed tortuously. Brandon began to lose focus. No longer was his mind concerned with his predicament or how much trouble he was in. So much worrying had produced so little. Now his mind was stuck on the security office. The office was cold, sterile, bland, and boring. Brandon didn't dare move, and his mind kept playing tricks on him. For instance, every once in a while, he could swear the walls were moving. Not fast, but closing in on him all the same. He couldn't prove it, but with each passing minute the room seemed to be getting smaller. It was an illusion, though. The room was not getting smaller, he was getting bigger. By this point, the young boy had grown to age twelve.

The bench he was sitting on also seemed to be tormenting him. It was just wood and metal, but every so often, it felt as though it were cushioned. He would squirm and fidget out of impatience, and his eyes would be drawn down to the bench. Nothing about it should seem so plush. And in fact, nothing was. The bench, like the room, remained unchanged. The only difference was Brandon. His age and height were both increasing, but they were not alone. A taller Brandon meant a heavier Brandon. His rear end was collecting fatty deposits, swelling in size, providing the softness Brandon was experiencing.

Had Brandon not been preoccupied by his fear, he may have noticed one element of the office that had changed. The computer screen on the desk had shut down completely. It wasn't facing him, but the silence of the electrical stirring could have been noticed. The computer part of the computer was gone from underneath the desk. Vanished. Disappeared into thin air. All that was left was the monitor.

Brandon felt a chill rush over his body. His outfit for Florida was a Mickey tee-shirt, some jean shorts, and a pair of black sandals. They were great for walking around in the muggy Florida heat, but in the air conditioned office, they were making him quite chilly. He rubbed his arms for warmth, noticing they felt more toned and muscular than he ever noticed before.

The sound of metal hitting metal snapped Brandon out of his bodily observation. He couldn't tell what had happened, but it sounded like something broke. Technically, it had. The armrests of the security guard's chair had fallen off. Not that they were damaged, it was simply the next change. They snapped off the metal frame and disappeared from the room before hitting the carpet. Brandon was tempted to investigate the sound, but was still afraid to leave the bench. The security guard was quite clear in his instructions: "Wait here, don't move."

And so Brandon waited. He waited, trying to ignore the changing room, oblivious to his changing body. Something was bound to happen sooner or later. He just didn't know what.
12132211111212212111211.title: Brandon starts changing

121322111112122121112111.content:
Brandon jostled his leg up and down, growing impatient. When he first sat down, his legs dangled off the bench above the floor. Now as his age crested to sixteen, they could rest flat on the floor while his back rested up against the wall. He was five feet tall now, which would be rather short for a 16 year-old boy, but Epcot had no plans on keeping him a boy much longer.

No longer a diminutive child, his clothes were now tight on his body. His body was growing, but his clothes were not. His tee-shirt showed off his navel and stomach, stopping just above his belly. The sleeves were tight on his shoulder, hardly even reaching down his arms. His shorts sat low on his waist and high on his thighs. He was much too young to carry a wallet (at least he was when he got dressed this morning), but it didn't matter now. There was no chance a wallet, or much of anything, would fit in the teeny pockets.

The changes were slow and subtle, Brandon hadn't even noticed. Not that he didn't have the chance. The boredom was overwhelming, and Brandon decided he had had enough. He couldn't handle it anymore. However long he had been detained, it felt like days. He couldn't take it anymore. He had to do something. Maybe as long as he didn't do anything too loud or nosy, he wouldn't get in any trouble. Just to be safe, he'd avoid peeking in the desk or the supply closet. Although, he was curious about the desk. It looked like metal when he came in. Now it looked like it was wood, and painted white. He reasoned it was an optical illusion, and didn't think about it again.

Brandon stood up off the bench. No alarms were going off. That was a good start. He took one step, then another. He was fine. He could have free range of the office. He breathed a sigh of relief. He looked around the room for any sort of distraction. Something on the floor caught his attention, hiding behind the wastepaper basket. It was bright red, and stood in stark contrast to the dull blue carpet. Somebody had left her purse behind.

The security guard was a burly, angry guy; this purse couldn't have belonged to him. Maybe another park guest was detained earlier today and left it behind? Possibly. But if there was a cell phone inside, Brandon could play a few games until the owner came back for it. And if the guard came back, Brendan could just drop it under the bench when he wasn't looking.

Cautiously, Brandon looked inside the purse. There was some lady stuff inside, which didn't interest him. But oh what luck, there was a cell phone hiding amongst the make-up. It was an iPhone with a pink rhinestone case. It was super girly, and Brandon felt kind of embarrassed holding it, but it was better than no phone at all. The funny part was, on the back of the phone, written in gold cursive, was the name "Brendan."

Why would such a girly phone inside a lady's purse have a boy's name inscribed on it? More than that, it was almost his own name. It was an awfully big coincidence. Brandon was often called Brendan my mistake... wasn't he? It certainly seemed like something he remembered, but the longer he thought about it, the harder it was to recall. Why would he be object to being called Brendan? That was his name.

Brendan turned on the cell phone, but no luck. It was password protected. He dejectedly put the phone back in the purse, but didn't put the purse back. He felt that he should, but didn't. He tried to reason why he should hold onto this purse any longer. What reason would a boy want a woman's purse?

Maybe... Maybe he could find gum inside the purse. Women sometimes carried gum or breath mints in their purse, didn't they? Yes, he concluded. That was a good answer. Brendan could keep the purse because he was looking for candy inside. Brendan joyfully opened the purse again, digging around, looking for anything sweet. As he rested the purse on his thigh he didn't even notice how daintily he crossed his legs at the knee.

He rummaged through the cosmetics, thinking he succeeded, but no. What he thought was candy was just a bottle of mint colored nail polish. The same color which was, at that moment, beginning to appear on his toenails. Brendan paid his feet no mind. He didn't even notice. How often does one look at their feet anyway? Not often. Brendan hadn't even noticed his black, velcro sandals had become white, strappy sandals with a buckle.

There was nothing in this purse for Brendan, but still, he held onto it a bit longer. He wasn't holding it, he just kept it by his side. For some reason, he felt a little more comfortable with it by his side. He didn't want to have a purse, but he felt as though he ought to keep it. In case the owner came looking for it, he reasoned. "I found your purse," Brendan would say, and she would say "Thank you, Brendan," and Brendan would be a hero. Despite his body aging past age 18, he was still thinking like an eight year-old.
121322111112122121112111.title: Brandon finds something interesting

1213221111121221211121112.content:
Brendan stood up and stretched, arching his back, letting his taught tummy strain as new muscles formed in his abdomen. Not an overwhelming six-pack, but enough to highlight his slim, trim physique as his waist pulled inwards, giving him a flat belly. Kegel muscles were also developing, though they were dormant for the moment.

Brendan itched at his chest. His shirt, as tight and form-fitting as it was, was still rather comfortable. Until now, it felt like a second layer of skin. But now there was some irritability. He couldn't quite describe it. It was as though there was a sock, leftover from the laundry, tucked under his shirt. Except the sock was squirming around his body like a hamster through a maze. And every now and then, there would be a rough poke.

The bra that was forming around Brendan's flat chest needed room to grow and expand. But Brendan's childish fidgeting made the process unignorable. The underwire couldn't help but prick him. If he had simply sat still, this process would be over and done with fast and painlessly. Just as simply as his briefs shifted into panties mere moments ago.

Preparing to return to the bench, Brendan was shocked to discover it was missing. The spot where it once sat was empty. It were as though the bench were sucked up into the wall. How could a piece of furniture up and vanish, he wondered. He was oblivious to the office chair's wheels disappearing, it's central swivel-component becoming rigid, splitting into four individual feet.

Brendan was getting sick of this. It was one thing to keep him locked up in a security office, but now this room was turning into some sort of fun house. He wasn't going to stand for this one minute more. He went over to the door, finding it to be locked. He pounded on the door, demanding to be heard. "Hello!?" he shouted to nobody. "Can ennyone hear me? Jou neet to open dis door right now. Sometheen weirt is going on. I... I... " Brendan gasped at his own voice. As much as he tried, he couldn't bring himself to speak correctly anymore.

Maybe he could call for help. The phone was still locked, but he remembered 911 calls could always be made in an emergency. He didn't know if 911 could help him, or if they would even believe him, but he was going to try anyways.

He reached into the purse for the phone once again. As he reached, the various baubles in the purse arranged themselves in a precise way. As Brendan's hand reached inside, it aligned perfectly with two bracelets and a ring. But he didn't care about the bangles or the shiny stone adorning his hand. He needed assistance.

Before he could dial, a text message popped up. "Dónde estás?" it said. Brendan didn't speak Spanish. He didn't know who this was, or what they were saying. "No estas lista?" a second message said.

Brendan felt like he was going to faint. His mind was rushing, filling with dread, and it felt as though his head was getting heavier by the second. In fact, it was. His hair was growing rapidly. Wavy tresses were stretching down the back of his neck, turning dark, mahogany brown.

With nowhere else to rest, he sat himself down on what was once the office chair. Brendan didn't care anymore what the officer thought. After all, Brendan was now in his mid-20s, and practically the same age as the guard who arrested him. He wasn't afraid of the little pendejo anymore.

He sat down on the backless chair, surprised at how high up we was sitting. It was more like a stool than a chair. He faced the monitor, which was now almost three feet across and four feet high. He had never seen a computer monitor this size in his life. And why would he? No one would need a monitor like this. Brendan could partially make out his reflection in the screen. It looked awfully dark. Monitors weren't designed to be reflective, it was just a byproduct. Brendan was surprised at what he saw. He was definitely taller, and lean. He was older, and his hair was longer. But something was amiss. Was he not supposed to look like this? If only he could see more clearly.

He lifted up his sunglasses. Brendan forgot he was wearing them. In fact, two seconds ago, he wasn't. But with the monitor no longer being a monitor, and the desk no longer being a desk, there needed to be some reason why Brendan could not see himself in a vanity mirror. It made more sense that Brendan was wearing sunglasses indoors than anything else. And so, Brendan was wearing sunglasses.

As he perched the oversized sunglasses on his head, with their thick white frames and dusky tinted lenses, he could suddenly see much better. The monitor finished shifting into a mirror, and Brendan could see himself properly. His narrow face with a pointed chin, his elegant nose, his thick, full lips. That was his face. He couldn't imagine any other. What he saw was real to him, and not strange in the slightest. Neither was his golden honey skin, shining with a warm tan glow. The kind of pallor that couldn't be gained by a week in the sun, but only by genes.

Another notification from the phone. There were three messages now. Brendan read them again. "Dónde es you?" said the first. "Not es you lista" was the second. Then came the third, the new one: "Casi es la hora" it said for a brief second. Brendan must have blinked, because he looked again and it said "Casi es la time."
1213221111121221211121112.title: Physical changes

choices: Brenda has no idea anything is wrong
12132211111212212111211121.content:
Brendan fiddled with the phone a little bit, feeling a ever more comfortable holding it in his hand. He rubbed the pink rhinestones, feeling the embossed lettering on the back. Six letters were solidly affixed. The seventh, the final N, was peeling right off. It was no more secure than a sticker on a piece of wet fruit. As Brendan unknowingly rubbed the errant letter from its position, it flaked away, leaving the name "Brenda" in its place.

The phone vibrated once again. Another text message. "Llegas tan late! Get dressed ahora." Brenda looked down at his clothing. He was dressed. Granted, the crop top and hotpants he was wearing were different than the shorts and tee he was wearing an hour ago, but they were still clothing. He was dressed, wasn't he?

He looked over at the storage locker. What was once a cold, metal cabinet for office supplies was now a bright wardrobe, matching the vanity in style and color. Curious, Brenda opened the wardrobe up to find what was inside. Sure enough, there was an outfit waiting for him. Wrapped in plastic, freshly laundered and pressed, hanging from the closet rod.

Brenda removed the dry cleaning bag and was shocked to find a white dress with embroidered flowers. This had to be some sort of joke, he rationalized. The room, the furniture, the purse, the phone, and now a dress? It had to be a joke. Somebody was recording him, surely. He would be a laughingstock on Youtube in a matter of hours. He threw the dress on the floor and returned to the vanity, crossing his arms in a huff. They would have to get up pretty temprana in the mañana to fool him.

He took another look at himself in the mirror. His caramel skin, his pouty lips, his dark hair, his long hairless legs, his wide hips, his dainty hands and feet... What would he ever be wearing a dress for? It was ridiculous. He looked again. He began to see the cracks around his eyes, the lines around his smile, the splotches on his skin. His age was creeping into the early thirties, and the telltale signs of aging were coming with it. And along with the physical signs were the mental conditioning. Just as Brenda hadn't noticed his developing adult body, he didn't notice he was thinking like a 32 year-old.

Brenda looked down at his outfit. The tight shorts showing off his plump rear. The belly on display for the world to see. More skin than a person his age should be exposing. At a family theme park, no less. What had he been thinking? This outfit may have been stylish in his teenage years, it may have been trendy in his twenties, but for someone his age, it was awfully tacky.

Maybe he should change. No, he definitely should change. It wouldn't be so bad to wear a dress, would it? What was a dress anyways? A permanently closed bathrobe, basically. He was alone, somewhere private. No one was around to judge him. And of course nobody was recording him. That would be simplemente loco.

Brenda walked back to the wardrobe, picking the outfit off of the floor. The cheap, commercial-grade carpeting had softened to a plush white. It almost matched the dress, except the carpet was further changing, taking on a pinkish tint. Brenda undid the button on his shorts and shimmied the garment down his legs. The gyration of his hips as he wiggled loose the tight clothes would unnerve any onlooker. His privates were still noticeable through the front of his panties, bulging out unmistakably. Aside from the bulge, Brenda's lower body was the envy of any woman and the desire of any man.

The shirt came next. Brenda tucked his thumbs under the cap sleeves, careful not to scratch himself with the elongated nails. He pulled straight up, getting the tee ensnared in his hair. He tossed the teeny Minnie Mouse shirt onto the floor with his shorts. He ruffled his hair, trying to get the wavy locks to fall back into order. His hair reached his shoulders now, and was super thick. Thick, but luxurious. Even under fluorescent light, it shone and glistened like onyx.

The bra on Brendan's body was strapless, bound tight around his flat chest. With no breasts to support, it simply felt like a belt he was wearing far too high on his body. He didn't remember putting a bra on this morning, but Brenda was having trouble remembering a lot of things. His name, his age, his home, his family, how he got to the park... He had ideas. He had vague recollections. But the hazy memories that were fading were in stark contrast to the new identity rapidly forming. It confused him too much, so he didn't think about it all. He just admired how good the virginal white bra and panty set looked against his mocha skin.

He undid the zipper in the back of the dress and stepped inside. He hesitated for a moment, as if some little voice in the recesses of his mind was compelling him to stop. He laughed it off and pulled the dress up. The dress fit rather oddly with no straps to go over his shoulder and no bust to support it. But with some careful positioning, he managed to keep it in position as he pulled the zipper shut. He felt the zipper caress his backside as it was drawn upwards.

The dress was pure white, cleaned to perfection by the Disney World laundry service. The embroidered flowers popped in contrast with vivid red, violet and yellow hues. The skirt was tiered, ornamented with lacy frills that shuffled and shifted as he moved. He secretly liked the way it sounded and played with his outfit for a few moments. A flouncy ruffled layer fell from under his arms, draping down over his chest, hiding his lack of breasts. A similar ruffled layer sat just above his sandals. Brenda looked himself up and down. He looked so good. Why was he ever so apprehensive about wearing a dress?
12132211111212212111211121.title: Brendan needs to get dressed

121322111112122121112111211.content:
Brenda sat down at the vanity. He picked up the phone and typed in the four digit passcode without thinking. He fully intended to reply to the mystery individual. He wanted to type, "I'm ready to go. Whenever you're ready."

The problem was, as Brenda sat there, phone in hand, he had a hard time parsing the words. Some of them he knew. 'I'm,' 'to go,' and 'you're' were easy enough. But the rest he had to stop and think about. He knew the words, he was saying them in his head, but his fingers weren't typing them. It was almost as though he had difficulty spelling them. But that wasn't quite it.

He looked at the phone, trying to formulate the sentences properly, when a lock of hair cascaded down over his eye. He brushed it back like second nature, but caught a glance of himself in the vanity mirror as he did. The woman staring back wasn't him. He slowly turned, trying to realize exactly what had happened. This wasn't him. This wasn't his hair. This wasn't his face. Those weren't his hands. This wasn't his body. He was supposed to be an 8 year-old boy, not some 36 year-old woman.

"Soy una womeen!" Brenda shrieked. He threw his hands up to his mouth, surprised at his own voice. The accent, his vocabulary, his tan skin, it was all making sense. He wasn't just a woman, he was a Mexican woman.

"No, no, no, no..." he repeated to himself. His hands shot to the back of his dress, determined to remove the vile garment. This fingers tried with great futility to liberate him, but he simply could not find the zipper. It was nestled somewhere between his shoulder blades, but he either couldn't reach it, or could not be found among the draping collar.

A thought struck Brenda. The dress had no sleeves or collars. He could simply pull it off, up over his head. Like a giant shirt. Brenda grabbed the hems of the tiered skirt and pulled upwards. Had he not been alone in the dressing room, everyone would be in full view of his panty-clad legs.He struggled and groaned as he tried to get the flowing mass of fabric up over his head. Between all the fluffing material and the tightness around his waist, Brenda simply couldn't make any progress. He dropped the skirt down. He sat down at the vanity again. He looked at himself in the mirror in defeat.

He was red from all the physical exertion, but now he looked even older. Almost 40. He was older than his mother. How much older was he going to get?

There was a knock at the door. Somebody finally realized Brenda was trapped inside. He would finally be free of this prison. He bounded up, racing to the door, opening it with a big toothy smile. He never once considered what was waiting for him on the other side.
121322111112122121112111211.title: This isn't right at all

1213221111121221211121112112.content:
Brenda opened the door. Four ladies were staring at him, smiling. All were wearing dresses exactly the same as his. "Ahi you are," said one of them. "Vamanos. Estaremos late," said another. Brenda understood what they were saying, but was recognizing fewer English words. They wanted him to come with them.

He tried to protest. Metamorphosing into a stranger was terrifying in private. To do so surrounded by others was much worse. Were these people also changed the way he was? No, he realized. These were real women. And he looked just like them. He was dressing like them. He was talking like them. Now he was expected to act and intermingle with them. He wasn't just changing, he was being assimilated.

The ladies, actually, had no idea about what the park was doing to the boy. As far as they knew and remembered, Brenda was always a coworker. Brenda worked for Epcot longer than any of them, and at age 40, was their superior. It was why they all shared a dressing room while Brenda had one to himself. Their hands were clean. They had no idea today was a strange day for Brenda or anyone else. To them, the only oddity was Brenda's reluctance to get changed and meet them on time.

Brenda tried to evade his coworkers and make excuses why he couldn't leave. The ladies wouldn't accept his pleas. Two grabbed his arms and began pulling him. The other two pushed his shoulders, encouraging him to walk. Brenda took one last look over his shoulder at the dressing room. Any indications it had once been a security office had long disappeared. His purse, cell phone and other personal belongings were safely locked inside.

Five raven-haired women walked through the corridors to the park. One walked much more reluctantly and unwillingly. The loose bodice of his dress was becoming tighter as the mammary glands beneath his skin grew. He had breasts now. They were small for a woman his age, but far too big for the little boy he was supposed to be. Try as he might, Brenda was having a harder and harder time remembering his old life. He couldn't remember his friends, or his bedroom, or what state he lived in. He remembered other things now, like how to use a curling iron, and attending ESL classes, and where his car was parked in the staff parking lot. How old was he supposed to be? A child, he was sure, but the real number was long lost. He could only remember the number 43. Brenda cringed, realizing he was now older than his mother.

"Por qué estás acting so rara, Brilmda?" One of the girls asked. He knew exactly why he was acting weird, but how could he explain it? These women were thinking so little of him at the moment, and he didn't want to make it worse. And what did 'Brilmda' mean? It didn't sound like any English word, but he knew it wasn't Spanish. Oh no, Brilmda realized, his name had changed again.

Brilmda needed to calm down and compose himself. Yes, he was in a bad situation, but drawing attention to himself wasn't helping. He gently pulled his hands out of the women's grips and walked, matching the gait of his colleagues. His enunciated hip movement couldn't be seen beneath the dress, but he could feel them naturally rolling with each step. As age lines grew around his eyes and on his forehead, he wondered just how far his changes would go.

The women surrounding him were chatting, laughing, sharing stories of their families and friends. All in fluent Spanish. Brilmda kept up with every word and detail. He didn't dare join in. His changes were only skin deep. He could reverse this somehow, he convinced himself. He had to fight any mental changes. He focused on his interests. Riding his bike down really big hills. Playing soccer after school was over. Bringing sangria to the neighborhood picnic. No! Playing video games in the basement. Watching LPs on Youtube. Day trips to the outlet mall for shoes and earrings. No! Playing with the neighbor's puppy. Gorging on pizza and wings. N-no? Driving to the Indian casino and playing the slots. Singing along to Selena while stuck in traffic. Sunday Night Wrestling on TV. No! Paint your own pottery classes. Book clubs with trashy romance novels. Saturday afternoons at the Go-Kart track. No!

The ladies stopped walking. Brilmda, not paying attention bumped into the young lady in front of him. Brilmda recognized the door. The theme park was on the other side of the door. The women all adjusted their hair, checked their outfits, and made sure their dresses sat right on their bosoms. Taking the hint, Brimlda did the same. Although his dress still seemed rather loose on his B-Cups, it sat as properly as it possibly could. There would be no slippage, and that was the important part.

The ladies donned big, cheesy Disney smiles and walked through the door. They had kept the Disney World crowds waiting long enough.
1213221111121221211121112112.title: Who are you people?

12132211111212212111211121122.content:
Brilmda tried to calm himself as he moved through the crowd of people. Flanked on all sides by identically dressed women, he couldn't flee if he wanted. He was so mortified, he didn't dare risk drawing attention to himself. His outfit was conservative (it was Disney World, after all), but was still a strapless dress. He felt so exposed. His legs, his breasts, and his hips were all modestly covered, but still visible enough to paralyze him with fear. He hated this. He didn't want anyone to see him

The girls kept walking until they reached an alcove by the pathways. A mariachi band was playing an upbeat song, entertaining the gathering crowd. The women lined up in front of the band, taking a pose as the band finished their current song. Brilmda finally realized what was expected of him. He was supposed to be a dancer.

Brilmda didn't know how to dance. He had never danced before, especially not to such foreign music, and doubly so not as a woman. And now he was here, in public, in front of dozens of people, expected to perform. And he was wearing a dress. There was no way out. Brilmda tried to usher himself to the far end of the dance line. Maybe if he was on the outskirts, fewer people would notice him. The other ladies, confused by this action, ushered him back to the center of the stage. Brilmda was sunk. Not only was he on display, not only was he expected to dance, he was supposed to be the leader.

The band began playing. What could he do? Brilmda was stuck. He resigned himself to his fate. Just move to the music, try not to trip, and maybe nobody will notice too much. They were all tourists. They wouldn't know what authentic Mexican dancing looked like.

Brilmda grabbed the hem of her dress with one hand and let the draping layers of her underskirts show. The dress was full; he would need to purposefully trip to even expose the slightest bit of skin above his knees. He rhythmically waved his hand around, letting the motion of his outfit move kinetically with the music.
