The linen fabric and embroidered flowers felt so familiar between his fingertips, as though he had felt such a thing every day for thirty years.

As he saw growing smiles from the audience, he began to incorporate hip movements and leg movements. As he spun, he saw the two women to his left matching his movements. He spun around again, the other direction. The two women to his right were also in step. Brilmda had no idea what was happening. He was supposed to be making everything up off the top of his head. How could this all be choreographed? Was he somehow doing this correctly? How could he possibly be dancing such a perfect baile folklorico?

He didn't stop to think. He got this far without thinking, it would get him the rest of the way. Thinking would only distract him. He just kept twirling his skirt and moving his feet along with the music. He let himself get lost in the music. Dancing and twirling to the delight of an audience. And a new audience, every day. An audience who would never get bored, who would always want to see more. What a delightful task it was.

Brilmda kept dancing, kept twirling, and kept smiling. He didn't care anymore if anyone thought it was foolish. He didn't care he was on display. He didn't even pay any attention to the weight of his breasts, full and heavy, sagging, as their natural perkiness diminished in middle age. They were his breasts. He had them since he was a teenage girl. Why pay them attention now?

As the song stopped, the ladies posed. Beneath her toothy smile, Brilmda deftly wheezed, trying to catch her breath before the next song began. At just past 50, her spirit and energy were as vivid as ever, but her body was slowing down. She could still dance better than any of her coworkers, and she had no plans of retiring soon. She just needed an extra moment to let her aching joints and tired muscles rest, that's all. With each shallow inhalation, Brilmda could feel tightness in her waist. It was her control-top panties, snapping back into position amidst all the sweat, the agitation of the dance, and the disappearance of any exterior organs.

A little girl in the front row said something to Brilmda. "Yurp ridd he," she said. Brilmda didn't know what that meant. She tried to think about it. She had to translate the words in her head. "Eres bonita" she eventually decoded. That's what the girl meant.

Brilmda wanted to thank her, but felt uncomfortable saying the word "gracias" to the child. She might not understand. Brilmda tried to think of a way to express his feelings in a satisfactory way. "Thane queue," she said to the child. The child beamed in delight.

"Wutt zyorn aim?" the child asked. "Cuál es tu nombre?" Brilmda deduced. "Me llamo Brilmda," she wanted to say. "Mine aim hiss Brimelda," she said. Her name sounded odd. Speaking two languages often made certain things sound odd. It's not as though her name was magically changing. That would be ridiculous.

The music started again. Brimelda waved goodbye to the little girl and fell back in line. She grabbed the hem of her skirt and began dancing once again. She loved this. She wanted everyone to see her.



Someone's about to find Brimelda. Who is it?
12132211111212212111211121122.title: Brilmda entertains the crowds

121322111112122121112111211222.content:
The crowd shifted in size. Patrons were coming and going, watching the scene, enjoying the music, then moving on. But such theme park entertainment is designed to be temporary. Park guests are attracted to certain areas at certain periods for certain amounts of time. This draws crowds to shops and restaurants in the area, and away from overcrowded attractions and paths. Disney World was like a machine, and Brimelda and the girls were just another cog.

After fifteen minutes, the mariachis took a bow, the ladies waved goodbye, and all retreated back to the employee area. It was important to relax and cool off between sets. Brimelda was perused by a security guard as she retreated. At first, he seemed unimportant. Just another face. Then Brimelda started to remember him more and more. Memories of him formed as a common figure in Brimelda's life, just like everyone in the Mexico pavilion. They were her coworkers, she saw them every day. Still, this particular security guard seemed unique. The closer he got, the more important the man felt. As though he had a very large role in her life.

"Hello, Brimelda," said the guard. Brimelda was happy to speak with someone who spoke her language. She didn't have to translate anything in her head before she talked. "I heard you got in a little late today?"

"Oh, it's so strange. I don't know what happened. I must have lost track of time. One minute, I'm going about my day, the next, the girls are texting me, asking where I am, and practically knocking down the door to my changing room."

"Of course. You're a hero to them. They don't want to see you fired. Speaking of which, don't let the boss see you without your name tag." He pulled a name tag from his pocket, giving it to the flustered dancer.

"Imelda" it said.

She pinned it above her left breast, careful it wouldn't get lost in the folds of the fabric. As she did, an unyielding pressure came from behind Imelda's eyes. If felt like someone blew sand in her face. She clamped her eyelids in pain, but the stinging sensation disappeared instantly. Her uncharacteristic blue eyes had turned dark brown, completing the last physical change.

"Did you talk with mom last night?" the guard asked. "What did she say?"

Imelda nodded with a smirk. "She said she and dad would be flying in on the thirteenth. They're staying at the resort, but skipping the parks. Then she went on, as usual, chastising me for never getting married and having kids."

"They mean well, but they come from another era. They want you to be happy."

"It's annoying," Imelda said. "I thought you having kids would get them off my back, finally."

"Eh, you know mom. You were her favorite. When you moved to America, she was in tears. When I moved here, she didn't even take me to the airport."

"Let's agree that we're happy to see dad."

The two shared a laugh and parted ways. Imelda was happy to work with her little brother, Diego. As an immigrant, she spent years trying to fit into a strange new country. It took a long time, and it wasn't easy. Ten years later, her brother moved to Florida. She sponsored his immigration, got him a job in the park, and helped him acclimate. It was a luxury she never had. And since then, Diego got married, fathered four kids, earned many promotions, and knew it was all thanks to the love and hard work of his big sister. He would be nothing without her.

Imelda's eyes turned to the giant pyramid. Had Imelda known the events which transpired a mere hour ago, she would remember the significance. Diego was tasked with apprehending a young boy who was climbing the pyramid. The kid's parents were nowhere to be found, so the delinquent was locked inside the security guard's office until they could be located. But the boy and the office disappeared along with all memories of the incident. Diego would be figuratively nothing without Imelda. But Imelda would be literally nothing without him.




Time to transform someone new. Two boys left. Who's turn is it?
121322111112122121112111211222.title: The security guard

1213221111121221211121112112221.content:
Aaron tried to blend into the crowd as best he could. Maybe he wouldn't transform if he couldn't be found. If he ran too fast, it would be suspicious. They'd find him immediately. But if he walked too slow, he would spend more time in the park. The more time he spent in the park, the better odds he would transform anyways.

He made it through four pavilions so far. Nothing terrifying had happened yet. No strange thoughts, no strange changes, no strange feelings. None yet.

It was as though Aaron forgot how to walk normally. He tried to match speed with the tourists around him. But they were all milling about, visiting the shops and exhibits and shows. This was a theme park, after all. Nobody besides Aaron had any intention of making a speedy exit.

The prospect of turning into a strange woman bothered Aaron. It was a terrible fate, yes, but it wasn't the only thing bothering him. Aaron had reason to be miserable. Everyone else did not.

All around him were people looking, feeling, and acting miserable. Some people were exhausted from walking all day. Others were fatigued from standing in the sun too long. There were people upset with the crowds. There were people upset with the high prices. There were people hungry, and thirsty, and tired of carrying souvenirs all day.

Worst of all was the garbage. People were so wasteful and sloppy. A few candy wrappers here, a few discarded napkins there, a few empty cups everywhere else. The park staff was doing their best to keep the park clean, but it was an uphill battle. Aaron gathered a few disposable paper plates left on a bench, depositing them in a nearby trash can. It felt good to help, even a little bit. It made him forget about his poor circumstances. It made him forget about Brandon.

Poor Brandon, Aaron thought to himself. He was only a little kid. Aaron said things he didn't mean, and acted in ways he shouldn't. He was supposed to be a role model. He wasn't angry at Brandon, he was mad at the circumstances. Aaron couldn't swallow his shame. He promised he would never treat Brandon as the annoying little brother of his friend Zack again. He would treat him right. He would be courteous. He would friendly. Of course, first things first, he would have to find Brandon.

No easy task. Brandon no longer existed. And in a few minutes, neither would Aaron.

Aaron walked into the next pavilion. Adorned back to front with tall arches and golden roofs, the scenery was unmistakable. He was in China. The savory smells wafting from the restaurants were intoxicating, but Aaron was on a mission. He needed to escape, and fast. Nothing could distract him. Not dancing dragons, not leaping acrobats, not choreographed warriors dancing with swords. The only thing Aaron wanted to see was a sign saying "Thank you for visiting, Come back soon."

Aaron stopped in his tracks as a plate of pork lo mein was dropped at his feet. A clumsy tourist had tried and failed to snake their way from the Lotus Blossom Cafe to a nearby picnic table. They got caught in the crowd, lost their balance, and dropped their entire lunch on the ground. Another inch, and Aaron would be wearing it.

A nearby park employee saw the incident, sympathizing with the poor diner's misfortune. The employee whisked the guest away, back into the restaurant. They were being escorted to the front of the line for a quick replacement. It was a marvelous display of compassion, but it didn't clean up the mess.

Aaron looked at the mess in front of him. He considered trying to flag down a janitor, but there were none in sight. Aaron steeled himself, bent down, and scooped as many noodles as he could back onto the plate. He popped into the restaurant, dropping the inedible meal into a nearby trash bin. Ironically, this is when he spotted the custodian.

The custodian stepped outside, and swept up the remaining mess before anyone could step in it. Aaron looked around for a place to wash his hands, but couldn't find any. His hands were sticky with soy sauce and didn't want to accidentally smear that gunk all over the door handles. Surely there was a bathroom nearby.
1213221111121221211121112112221.title: Once upon a time in the China Pavilion

choices: Aarong returns the spray bottle and rag
12132211111212212111211121122212.content:
Aaron snaked his way around crowded tables and hungry patrons. He needed to find a restroom to wash his grubby hands. Surely there was one around somewhere, but he couldn't find it. Desperate to clean his hands, he found a spray bottle and a clean rag sitting on a bussing station. A few quick spritzes from the bottle, and a wipe with the rag, and his hands were clean. Aaron was so pleased to finally feel clean, he didn't notice he shrank two inches.

Ten feet to his left, a clumsy kid spilled their Coke on their table. The poor child's father jumped up startled, trying to avoid the soda spilling on his pants. He tried to sop up the spilled drink as best he could with his napkins, but it was ineffective. Looking up, he saw Aaron holding the rag and spray bottle. He sheepishly gestured at the situation, clearly needing assistance.

Aaron gladly helped the man out. He soaked up the soda with half the rag, sprayed the table down, and wiped it clean. The father was absolutely grateful, taking his daughter back to the soda fountain for a refill and a tighter lid. Aaron dropped the spent rag into the bus tub, and was about to deposit the spray bottle too. But then he noticed another table to his right. A family had finished their meal, but left all their garbage behind, There were easily a dozen people standing around awkwardly, holding full trays, looking for a place to sit. And these uncouth people couldn't bother to clear their table. Shaking his head, Aaron gathered up the plates, napkins and plastic utensils, stacked the trays and deposited the garbage in the trash can. Immediately, a new family sat at the cleared table.

"Thank you so much," they said to Aaron.

"Oh, you're welcome," Aaron said. Such a nice family. But it was time to go now.

"Excuse me," said a new voice. Aaron turned around. A harried woman carrying a two year-old infant in one hand and a large diaper bag over her shoulder was talking to him. "You're completely out of plastic spoons. Can you help me?"

Aaron sized up the situation. He had to get moving, but this lady literally had her hands full and there was no restaurant employee in sight. It wouldn't take too long to help her out, right? Of course not. Aaron walked over to the self-serve counter, taking note of the empty spoon holder. Aaron considered how he could fill it. On a whim, he kneeled down to peer inside a cabinet. Doing so, he felt the fabric of his jean shorts under his knees. He didn't pay it much consideration, but he didn't think his jorts were that long.

He opened a cabinet, noticing boxes of napkins, lids, sauce packets, chopsticks... and sure enough, plastic forks and spoons. He grabbed a handful, placing them into the serving receptacle. The stressed woman breathed a sigh of relief as Aaron handed her a clean spoon.

"Thank you, you've made my day..." she paused, prompting Aaron for his name.

"Oh, Aarong," he said, confused by the words coming out of his mouth. Why did he add a G to the end? He must be tired, Aarong convinced himself.

"Thank you, Aarong. I hope my daughter grows up to be as helpful as you."

The lady and her daughter left, returning to their table, both smiling. Once again, Aarong was happy to help. He looked down, realizing he was still carrying the spray bottle from earlier, and a clean rag. He didn't remember bringing them along. He was so surprised he was still carrying them, he didn't notice his shorts reaching a full inch below his knees. He certainly must be tired. It was time to go.
12132211111212212111211121122212.title: An alternative solution

choices: He tries to escape through the kitchen
He flees through an emergency exit
121322111112122121112111211222122.content:
Aarong set down the cleanser and rag at the service station. He couldn't quite put his finger on it, but there was something wrong about this restaurant. He needed to leave, and he needed to go now.

As he walked through the restaurant, he passed another table covered in refuse from departed diners. He tried to ignore. He tried to walk on by. But Aarong couldn't make it three steps before turning around and bussing the table. He collected all of the garbage, deposited in the nearest garbage bin. He put his hands on his hips, satisfied in a job well done. His hips felt wider than usual.

He looked down to examine his body, but was frightened by what he saw. Not so much his brand new birthing hips reaching out a few extra inches; he didn't get a chance to see them fully. He was too distracted. In his hands, he was once again holding the spray bottle and rag. He dropped them in fright.

He knew for certain he left them behind. There was no logical reason he could be holding them now. As the bottle crashed to the floor, a little bit of cleanser spritzed out. Aarong couldn't feel most of it. Only a little bit on his shins. The rest was absorbed by his shorts which were now grown halfway down his calves.

Something was clearly wrong. Aarong needed to get out of the restaurant and out of the park. He wanted to run out the door, but couldn't sprint with all these park patrons surrounding him. He moved as fast as he could to his right, but only found a dead end. He tried going left instead, but only found another wall. He was lost. He was all turned around, and couldn't find the exit no matter where he looked. The restaurant was huge, and seemed to be getting bigger. It didn't help that he shrunk another two inches in height.

Aarong searched and searched, but could not locate the exit. He did, however, locate the restrooms. He didn't need them now, but they were a welcome sight. He could escape the crowds, compose himself, calm down, and think rationally about how to escape this labyrinth of a restaurant.

The bathrooms were unisex with a big male/female sign on the door. Aarong entered and splashed some water on his face. The cold water felt good against his hot skin. He toweled off his face, not noticing how much straighter his hair looked than normal. He wanted to throw away the paper towel, but couldn't. The trash bin was overflowing with discarded towels. He looked around the bathroom, and there were paper towels everywhere. On the counter, on the floor, crumpled up in the sinks, everywhere.

Aarong was disgusted by the sight. He could just ignore it, but what if somebody was outside waiting to come in? They'd see the mess and assume Aarong made it. No, he had to clean it himself. He found an empty trash bag in the supply closet and began collecting all the waste. When he collected all that, he emptied the trash bin, adding a fresh liner, and depositing the full bags through the convenient trash chute.

There was a sign on the wall next to the bathroom door. "This bathroom last cleaned:" followed by names of park employees and the time. Sure enough, the last cleaning was an hour ago. Aarong felt obligated to sign his name. He wrote as neatly as he could, but when he was done, the letters looked as though they read "Airong."

Airong considered scratching out the name and trying again. But when he reached up to grab the pen, he couldn't. His hands were full with a spray bottle and a clean rag. He let out a scream, threw the cursed objects as hard as he could, and ran out of the bathroom.

Had Airong looked back while fleeing, he would have noticed the unisex bathroom sign was now missing. There were two bathrooms now, one for each gender. And Airong had stepped out of the ladies' room.


Where does Airong go looking now
121322111112122121112111211222122.title: Leave them behind

1213221111121221211121112112221221.content:
Airong could feel his sanity slipping away. The park was playing tricks on him. It was deliberately confusing him. A confused person was easier to manipulate. How much longer would this last? Airong rubbed his temples, not realizing how much his hair had grown. Not long, but it was definitely covering his ears now.

If he couldn't find the front door to the building, maybe he could find the back door. The park staff had to come and go from somewhere, right?

Airong made absolutely certain his hands were empty, and entered the door marked "Staff only." With each step, his pant legs inched closer to the floor. The tailored hem stopped properly at his ankles. They could no longer be considered shorts in any sense. He was wearing full-length pants.

This time was different, however. His slacks weren't growing; they were already reached the proper length several minutes ago. The pants had stayed the same length. It was his body that was shrinking. Airong dropped a final three inches. He now stood a diminutive 5' 1" tall. Rather short for an American teenager, but an appropriate height for the person he was becoming.

Airong nervously slunk through the commercial kitchen. Wait staff were taking orders from the window. Chefs were operating fryers and stove tops. Knives were flying, chopping meat and vegetables. Everything operated like a well-maintained machine. Airong was preparing himself to be screamed at. Somebody would notice him and order him out of the kitchen. But no one did. He breathed a sigh of relief. How fortunate that nobody noticed him.

Such was not the case. Everybody noticed him. Nobody thought he didn't belong.

Moving through the kitchen, Airong found storage cabinets, refrigerators, closets, and many other doors, but none of them led outside the restaurant. He was just as lost inside the kitchen as he was in the dining room. Worse still, his eyes were beginning to hurt. The dining room was naturally illuminated by sunlight. It was inviting and comforting. The kitchen was lit by harsh fluorescent lights. The contrast hurt Airong's eyes. Everything he saw was beginning to grow muddy and dull. His blue pants were looking black. His white shirt was looking yellow. And his usual pale skin was turning tan. If he had a mirror, his brown would look darker than it had ever been.

He was just about to leave the kitchen in defeat. Before he could, a voice yelled at him. Airong jumped, startled. The man operating the dishwasher needed his attention. Airong didn't know quite what he had said. He didn't speak Chinese. But he knew, somehow, it was directed at him. Airong shrugged, unable to help.

The dishwasher calmed himself down and replied in a heavily accented voice.

"Go take seese tarays to se floh," he said, motioning at a stack of trays sitting on a drying rack. There was limited space at the dishwasher's station, and everything was stacked upon each other. He needed to make room to continue working. The trays were cleaned and dried, and didn't belong here any longer.

Airong was conflicted. On one hand, he wasn't supposed to be back here in the first place. On the other hand, if he was going to be wandering around a restricted area, it was important he not make any enemies. He'd better do as he was told before he got in trouble.

Airong picked up the stack of trays with both hands, bracing the weight against his chest. Rather than feel the hard plastic slam against his ribcage, something was cushioning the force. His shirt and his pectoral muscles were there, sure, but that wasn't it. Something soft and pillowy was underneath, stuck underneath his shirt. What was he feeling and why was it so sensitive?

He didn't stop to find out. There would be time later. Right now, those trays needed to go out... someplace. Airong wasn't quite sure where he was going with all these trays, but there was only so many places to try. Obviously trays didn't belong in the kitchen, so he walked back into the dining area.

And a tray wouldn't help the patrons if they've already moved their food, so they must belong near the ordering stations. Airong walked behind the counter, nobody blinking an eye as he entered another restricted area.

And trays would have to be easily accessible to each counter clerk, so they'd be in a neutral spot away from the cash registers. Probably somewhere near the pickup window. Sure enough, Airong let his feet guide him to a near-empty stack of restaurant trays. They were exactly where he determined them to be. Airong had completely rationalized away brand new memories of the restaurant's layout and operations.

Airong dropped the clean trays in their proper spot, freeing his arms. Rather, momentarily freeing his arms. As he turned around, ready to leave, he felt his fingers grabbing something. He reached up, bringing his hands to eye level. Unbelievably, it had happened again. Once more, unwillingly, his hands were clenching a spray bottle and a clean rag. He tried to rid himself of the infernal items once again, but this time was different.

When Airong had thrown the items before, he was alone. Or, at the very least, not in striking range of other people. Now, he was swamped on all sides by restaurant workers. No one thought twice to Airong being behind the counter, but no one was expecting him to launch projectiles. This time, as Airong threw items aside, there would be consequences.

What happens?
1213221111121221211121112112221221.title: Through the kitchen

choices: There's a problem with Airong's feet
There's a problem with Airong's face
12132211111212212111211121122212212.content:
Airong tossed the bottle and rag away, right at the feet of a coworker. Things happened so quick, he didn't realize he thought of him as a coworker. The poor counter clerk stumbled, lost his footing, and dropped an entire plate of food right on Airong's shirt.

"I'm so sorry," Airong said, trying to help the poor man up.

"Oooh," the clerk said. He wasn't hurt, but he was dazed. He spoke something in Chinese, which Airong couldn't understand. He couldn't understand, except for the last word. The word was, "Careful." The clerk said it with perfect diction and inflection. He had no trace of accent. Airong was confused. Why would he speak an entire sentence in Chinese except for the last word?

The reason it sounded so proper was because nobody thinks they speak with an accent. It's always everybody else who speaks with an accent. As the physical changes continued, Airong's mind was beginning to learn Chinese. The man spoke Chinese, and Airong could understand him (partially, at least). He had no accent because he wasn't a Chinese-American immigrant speaking a second language. He was speaking his native tongue with his native inflection. A tongue and inflection which Airong was beginning to share.

Airong was so ashamed of the accident he caused, he scurried out from behind the counter. He was covered in General Tso's sauce. For the first time today, he wasn't alarmed he was holding a spray bottle and rag. He sighed and accepted it. The bottle held an all-purpose cleaner, and that's certainly something he needed now. He found an empty alcove of the restaurant and dabbed away as much of the sauce he could.

The sauce was a goopy, orange mess. Everywhere Airong wiped, he seemed to spread the sauce around more. When he began, it was just a splotch over his stomach. But now it was up, around, and all over his shirt. His belly, his sides, even his sleeves seemed to be turning a rich shade of golden yellow. Airong wondered if he even managed to spread the stain onto his back. He had, not that he could see.

Things felt specifically odd around his chest area. As he grazed over his breasts with the rag, something was just plain wrong. What was wrong with his breasts? He didn't want to fell himself up in public, especially not at Disney World, but there was something amiss. He felt his right, then his left, but couldn't quite piece the puzzle together.

As an elastic band materialized from nowhere, snapping against his chest, Airong realized the problem: His breasts were fine. It was his bra that was the problem. It felt as though he was wearing the wrong cup size. His tiny little breasts were bouncing around like a peaches in a paper bag. That was it, he was sure of it.

There would be time to fix this later. He had been wearing this bra all day hadn't he? And he didn't even notice until now. Right now, he had to get clean and get back to work. He felt his shirt with the back of his hand. The stain was still there, but it wasn't sticky at all. He would simply have to accept he was wearing a yellow shirt now.

He thought about what he said again. It was time to get back to work. Back to work? Back to work doing what?

He was still looking for the exit, sure, but didn't he have to do something else first? A voice, deep within his psyche was screaming, "No! No! You need to leave now! Before it's too late!" but that voice was growing more quiet with each second.

Airong tried to rub his forehead, accidentally bumping his forehead with the bottle he was holding, once again. He set them down, gently this time. He gently nudged his side swept bangs away from his eyes as his hair shifted fully to jet black.

"Get a grip," Airong told himself. "You're fine. You are okay. You are still alive. You are not going crazy. Your name is Airong Channing. Your name is Airong Channy. Your name is Airong Chan. Your name is Airong Chan. Your name is Airong Chan..." Airong stopped his self-affirmation. He was trying to calm himself down by repeating his own name, but it only made him more agitated. Why did his name sound so wrong? He said it a few more times to be certain. "Airong. Chan. Airong. Chan. Airong..."

He felt like a fool. No wonder it sounded so wrong. He was putting his family name at the end of his given name.

"Your name is Chan Airong. Your name is Chan Airong. Your name is Chan Airong." That was better. He smiled, calm, collected, and happy. Airong sauntered back into the main dining area, ready to tackle whatever challenges awaited him. Bottle and rag in hand.
12132211111212212111211121122212212.title: What a mess

121322111112122121112111211222122121.content:
Pushing in a chair, Airong stubbed his toe. It hurt for a moment. He was concerned he may be bleeding. He looked down, making sure his feet were all right. More than all right, his feet looked fabulous. The little wispy hairs he had been growing since puberty started were gone. His tiny little toes jutted out from his sandals, shrunk down to a lady's size five. Each toe was adorned with a perfect ruby topcoat. He didn't remember getting a pedicure recently. Or ever, for that matter.

As proud as he was of his feet, he was also ashamed. He was working at a restaurant. Wearing sandals was just asking for trouble. He could slip, or burn his feet, or stub his toe, as he just did. Airong cursed himself, wondering how he could be so foolish and irresponsible. It was no matter, as the hard rubber material of his boyish sandals was swelling, growing, and changing material to canvas. His heels were already covered by the time he lifted is head.

Airong began wiping a pair of greasy handprints off the window. He kneeled before the glass, feeling the tug of his trousers. The denim had long since withered into a thin cotton fabric, but the slacks continued to sit low. Concerned he may be displaying something improper, he paused to hike his pants up, over his hips, letting them sit on his waist as they should. He made sure to pull his underpants up along with them. He was mildly ashamed to be wearing so called "granny panties," but it's not as if anybody would ever see them. They were comfortable, and he needed free range of motion for all the bending and stooping.

Airong kneeled down again, the velcro straps of his shoes vanishing to anyone who noticed. The sides of his feet were now covered. He cleaned the window, stood up, and dusted debris off his uniform. With each movement of his hands against his pant legs, the fabric bunched ever so slightly. After three swipes, each pant leg sported a pressed crease reaching all the way down to the cuffed hems.

He wiped a bead of sweat from his brow. He had cleaned every table in the restaurant. But enough diners had come and gone, it was time to start again. He fixed his side-swept bangs, making sure they stayed out of his eyes. This morning, a young boy on vacation with his friends put styling gel in his hair. This morning, Airong recalled using a scented aerosol hair spray, which was still holding remarkably well. Not that he needed it for the rest of his short pixie bob. It was short enough to graze the top of his ears and the nape of his neck, but not long enough to be jostled throughout the day.

It was a very practical haircut. It matched his practical panties and his practical shoes, which now covered the tops of Airong's feet. Airong reminded himself the virtue of practicality. He wasn't a little kid anymore. He was 18 years old. He had to be a role model. Especially at Disney World. If a little kid came up to him, he would need to act as reliant as any other 23 year-old. Besides, at age 26, acting immature would cause speculation and gossip. Airong didn't want that. In his 29 years, he hated being the source of gossip. Whether it be the childhood rumors from his grade school days in Guangzhou, or the time he wore a low-cut blouse to his 32nd birthday party. He didn't mean anything by it, he was only celebrating. He wanted to feel young again. But at 35, he had to accept the days of his youth were behind him. He was an emissary for Disney now. He had to work hard. He had to work fast. And a showy haircut was impractical for a 38 year-old restaurant employee.

Airong stared idly at his feet, momentarily caught in memory. He wiggled his toes, remembering the pedicure he got from the girls at the salon last Tuesday. His toes were completely covered by the casual, slip-on shoes he wore, but it was no matter. They matched his manicure, and those red nails shone all the same.

He smiled as he turned and came face-to-face with the restaurant's front door. He paused. Something deep in the back of his head was telling him to leave. Leave and never look back. And strangely, as much as Airong loved this restaurant, he wanted to listen. Gripping his rag and spray bottle in his hands, this was his chance. If he wanted to flee, he could... but does he want to?
121322111112122121112111211222122121.title: There's a problem with Airong's feet

choices: What else is happening in the park?
1213221111121221211121112112221221212.content:
Airong knew he was forgetting something, but what? Something about the park. Something about himself. Something about leaving the park? Was that it? Was that why he was so desperate to find the exit? Yes, Airong decided. Yes, he must leave the restaurant, and fast. Airong threw his spray bottle and rag down on the ground, darting through the restaurant doors. Everybody stayed far out his way. This lunatic was in a hurry to go somewhere. Woe be to whoever got in Airong's way.

He ran ten feet. Then twenty. Then thirty. He was back in Disney World. He was back at Epcot. He had all the freedom he wanted. He could go anywhere, do anything, be anyone he wanted... Anyone at all. Airong looked down at his body. His clothes were designed and tailored for a woman. His skin and hair were soft and ladylike. He could feel his feminine curves under his clothes, especially as his breasts inflated to their proper size, filling his bra.

He wanted to leave so quickly a moment ago. And now that he had, what had come of it? He had left the restaurant, but now what? Was he still forgetting something important?

Where was he going? There was nowhere to go. Who was he looking for? No one was there. Why was he in such a hurry? There was no rush. Who would he be? Who could he be but himself?

Airong tugged at the collar of his shirt. The u-neck was stiffening, rising, becoming a mandarin collar, splitting and forming a cheongsam-inspired blouse.

He looked around. Dozens, no hundreds, of happy park guests were all around him. Some eagerly sniffed the air as they walked. The kitchen's ventilation hoods were broadcasting the tantalizing smell of pot stickers and crab rangoon.

The hungry passersby forked off their previous paths. They filed into the restaurant. Their mouths were watering. The aromas couldn't be ignored. And there were still tables to be cleaned, trays to be collected, napkin holders to be stocked... Airong couldn't leave. It wasn't the restaurant that needed him. It was the guests. Airong had to help the guests. It was in his nature. Before he ever started changing, it was in his nature.

With a moment of sudden clarity, Airong knew what had to be done. He excused himself to a nearby janitor's closet. Sitting on a shelf above the mop sink was exactly what he was looking for. He unclipped the safety pin, gently fastening it above his breast. "Meirong" said the name tag.

Meirong closed her eyes, letting them shift into their proper shape. She was a full-fledged Chinese woman from the inside out. She walked back into the restaurant. She saw her spray battle and rag, cast aside carelessly on the floor. She picked both up, and went to work, cleaning, helping guests, and most importantly, enjoying herself. Making other people happy made her happy. That's who she was.
1213221111121221211121112112221221212.title: Airong leaves the restaurant

choices: Zack tries to fight the change
Zack tries to see what he can get away with
12132211111212212111211121122212212121.content:
It's amazing how one can feel alone when surrounded by thousands of people. This morning, Zack Roman was with his family and his three best friends. Now, he was all alone. He was at one of the most popular and heavily trafficked vacation spots on the planet, but he was still all alone.

Zack couldn't control his own feet. We could walk just fine, but the masses of tourists engulfed him, inadvertently controlling where he went, and how fast. It was like he was adrift at sea, at the mercy of the currents. No matter how hard he tried to stop or change directions, he couldn't.

He found himself lost and disoriented. He couldn't even tell where he was anymore. All he could see were the backs of baseball caps and tee shirts screen-printed with Winnie-The-Pooh.

He could sometimes see the tops of buildings, lamp posts, and an occasional view of the lake, but mostly it was just people. He couldn't deal with the crowds. He didn't know if he was moving right or left, or backwards or forwards, or around in circles. He couldn't tell how far the park's entrance was.

Finally, finally after a tumultuous tour of the World Showcase, bereft of all visuals, he was free. He found an opening and took it. He looked around, seeing people enjoying slices of pizza. Zack had somehow wound up in the Italy pavilion. What's more, surrounded by shops and restaurants, Zack couldn't find the pathway back. He was trapped in some sort of courtyard.

And what's more, his shoes were starting to change. Zachary Roman was soon going to be Roman in another sense altogether.
12132211111212212111211121122212212121.title: It's time to change Zack

choices: Zack finds something interesting in the fridge
Zack finds something interesting in a closet
121322111112122121112111211222122121212.content:
Zack stared down at his feet. Not so much his feet anymore. They were 90% his feet, and 10% somebody else's. It was happening. It was the same thing that happened to Matt. The same thing that happened to Joe. And he didn't see it happen, but he felt certain it was the same thing that happened to Aaron and Brandon.

Was this it? Was the end of him? In ten minutes, he'd be more woman than boy. In twenty minutes, he'd be gone. He couldn't fight it. He couldn't stop it. God only knows if it could be reversed. He tapped his foot on the concrete walkway. He could hear his soft rubber soles becoming solid with every tap. Zack knew he was stuck. He would have to accept this.

He had to accept this, but he didn't have to smile as it happened. If Disney World wanted him to be a smiling, happy, brainwashed slave, they were going to regret it.

Zack entered a nearby restaurant. He was surprised; as classy and elegant the outside was, the inside featured a lot of exposed brick and stone. It looked rather old, but in a rustic way. The Tutto Gusto Wine Cellar prided itself on its atmosphere, recreating the image and feel of an Old World wine bar.

Zack was sure he would be thrown out at any minute; everyone around him was enjoying glasses of wine, and he was a fifteen year-old boy. He was wearing a pair of women's black leather flats, but he was still a 15 year-old boy.

"Scusi," a voice came from behind him. Zack was preparing himself for the worst. A waiter tapped him on the shoulder. "We are-a very busy, could you please take-a the order for table 19, per favore?"

Zack felt a gust of air conditioner hit his ankles. He could tell the cuffs of his socks were starting to creep up his legs. This is what the park wanted him to do, huh? Be a barmaid?

"No, I won't," Zack said. He left the waiter, standing in place. He paused, confused for a moment. Thinking nothing of it, the waiter resumed serving the park guests. He forgot almost instantly meeting Zack. The brief moment before he did, he couldn't imagine why he asked the young boy for help.

Zack found an entrance to the kitchen. Tutto Gusto was a smaller restaurant, serving only sandwiches, small plates, and lighter fare. But Disney World didn't believe in doing anything small. The kitchen was still top of the line, well stocked, and fully staffed. Once again, Zack braced himself. Any minute, somebody would yell at him to get out. No such admonishment occurred. He didn't belong here, but he didn't not belong here either. The staff saw him, they knew he was there. They were all neutral to Zack's presence.

He scratched the back of his leg with his other foot. He had a mosquito bite that had been bothering him all day. As he scratched it, his socks felt considerably thinner, and were at least halfway to his knees. He could look and confirm, but what good would it do? He knew what was happening. He paid it no mind. He still needed to cause mischief.


What does Zack find in the kitchen?
121322111112122121112111211222122121212.title: What he can get away with?

1213221111121221211121112112221221212122.content:
Zack opened a door. He knew what he was looking for, but couldn't find it. His mind was still his own, and he had no knowledge of the kitchen's layout. It had to be somewhere, though. Every kitchen in the world had it somewhere.

"Smettila di scherzare!" a voice came from behind him. "Devi servire i tuoi tavoli." Zack didn't even bother to turn around. Whoever it was could either throw him out or leave him alone.

"Sorry," he said, "I don't speak Italian."

"Aggh!" the voice said in pain, "Zackina, you are-a feisty one. Why do-a you play with my heart so much?"

Zack saw a gallon-sized bottle of blue liquid. It was precisely what he needed. He picked it up, still refusing to acknowledge his pursuer.

"I have never met you before," Zack said in a cold register. "I'm a fifteen year-old boy, and my name is Zack. Not Zackina.."

The line cook who was shocked. He couldn't have-- no, of course not. It was a mistake, and nothing more. He had for the briefest of moments mistaken the young boy for a grown woman. Were his eyes playing tricks on him? Was it the heat and stress of the kitchen? He returned to his station and resumed chopping vegetables. He put the incident behind him. Zackina wasn't even a real name.

The legs of Zack's shorts were long and billowed. They flared with each step, a multitude of fabric swallowing his thighs and knees. What hair he had on his legs was gone now, replaced with two toned, tanned legs. His socks were up well past his thighs and he could feel the pressure engulfing his pelvis and waist. They were pantyhose now.

He had to keep moving. There was the door to the restaurant ahead of him. Another five steps, and he'd be outside. Nobody noticed him. Nobody was stopping him.

Before he left though, perhaps there was more fun to be had in the restaurant. So many people here, oblivious to what's going on. Surely they could be brought in on the fun.
1213221111121221211121112112221221212122.title: Something interesting in a closet

12133.content: How about a teenage boy becomes the playmate his little sister always wanted due to a wish?
12133.title: Perhaps something a little more heartwarming?

121331.content:
Disney world is a land where dreams come true, a land of childhood wonder, over the years generation after generation of children have journeyed here with their families to relive and create memories, and a land of magic. Thousands of people travel to this wondrous land every day, yet few are aware that three magical witches have made their magical lair here. These witches search every day for a child in need of magical assistance.

Within this magical land every day the witches gather in front of their magical mirror which by sheer coincidence works exactly like the magic mirror from Snow White. “I cannot wait to see who we help today the youngest witch Sara breathed.

“We have the best job in the world.” The middle witch Mary responded.

“Will you two focus?” The eldest witch Agatha demanded. Agatha stood before their enchanted mirror, “Mirror, mirror on the wall, who is neediest of all?”

The image on the mirror changed from the reflection of the witches to a projection of a teenage boy and a little girl at the front gates.

“I don’t know why mom and dad wanted us to come here,” the teen questioned.

“Mom and dad said that Disney world was the place where they met as kids and that Disney was a place where dreams come true,” the little girl recited.

“This place is for little kids; I should be at a party getting wasted instead I’m wasting my time with you,” the teenager complained.

“You don’t mean that Kyle,” the little girl responded.

“I do Suzy,” Kyle said as he grabbed his younger sister's arm. “Come on; we’re going to get a map, get a few pictures, buy you a t-shirt, and have lunch then you’re going to spend the rest of the week in the hotel room with your dolls and the rest of your imaginary friends!”

Agatha shook her head, “I think we have a winner.”

Mary smiled as well, “come on Sara,” the witch said as she and her sister headed off.

“Hurry ladies,” Agatha added, “there’s a little girl out there who needs our help!”
121331.title: The magical land

choices: Suzy follows them to meet Agatha
Suzy tells them to go away
1213311.content:
Suzy sat down on a hard cement stump in the restaurant area, she and her brother had already done everything to make their parents think they’d had an excellent time so she knew they would be leaving soon. Suzy sighed, she was supposed to spend an entire week here, but now all she had gotten was a t-shirt, a few pictures, and a wave from Cinderella and she’d spend the rest of her so-called vacation like she spent all her time; alone and with only her imagination to entertain her.

Ever since Suzy was little, Suzy had always been a very smart girl, at first that was okay, but as Suzy entered elementary school she was quickly labeled a teacher's pet, and all her friends abandoned her, Suzy’s mother and father said sooner or later Suzy would make new friends. However, as Suzy waited and waited for new friends to arrive she found herself quite alone; her parents always working and her brother wanted nothing to do with her. Suzy found solace in her imagination; creating adventures for herself, and her toys were Suzy’s only means of entertaining herself until she discovered Disney. All of Disney’s movies had such cool characters, and it wasn't long before Suzy found herself escaping reality through Disney magic. Suzy would also imagine herself in the stories and find friends within the many characters in Disney. Suzy sometimes wished she was in a Disney movie as they were always filled with people who stuck together and lonely people who could find happiness and friendship. However, it sometimes occurred to Suzy that like ice powers, talking fish, and magical hair that could heal such people and miracles could only happen in movies.

“Poor child,” said a voice. Suzy looked up at her food, and she saw two women approaching her; one was slightly overweight with black hair, and the other was thin and blonde. “Poor, sweet child.” The black haired women went on.

“She has a severe problem,” the blonde woman agreed.

“Who, who are you?” Suzy asked. “Just so you know my brother is right over there!” Suzy pointed to a nearby table where her brother was flirting with some girls not even looking in her direction.

“Don’t be scared,” the blonde woman soothed, “we’re here to help you.”

“My name,” the black haired women entered the conversation, “is Mary and this is Sara.”

“We,” Sara responded, “are witches, and we can help you.”

“No way,” Suzy got up from her seat, “I saw The Little Mermaid, I know what happens. You offer to magically to take all my problems away, and then you take away my voice and try to take everything from me.”

“You are a wise child,” Mary complimented, “all magic comes at a price.”

“Ours is no different,” Sara added.

“However, if you come with us to meet our sister we can tell you our plan, then we’ll talk about payment,” Mary explained.

“Why should I go with you?” Suzy demanded.

“You said it yourself, you saw The Little Mermaid it is true magic got Ariel into trouble but did she not end up in her happily ever after?” Sara questioned. “Magic is only a tool, and though it always has a price it can bring happiness, and that’s what we’re offering you.”

“Aren't you tired of being alone?” Mary inquired, “aren't you willing to take the chance?”

Suzy looked over at her brother who still wasn't even checking on her. Sara smiled, “well?”
1213311.title: Suzy meets Sara and Mary

12133111.content:
“Come this way, child,” Mary led as she and Sara led Suzy through the park.

“Where are we even going?” Suzy asked.

“Our workshop,” Sara responded, “we’ve hidden our magical workshop in a deserted space in the park.”

The two witches led her away from the Disney’s legendary castle and through the forest. Eventually, Suzy saw several small, old, and poorly maintained figures of the seven dwarfs. “What is this place?” Suzy inquired.

“Back when families brought their food to the park this was a picnic spot,” Mary explained. “Families would come out here and picnic near their favorite dwarf, there’s also a model of the seven dwarves cottage which is where we’ve set up shop.”

“What happened?” Suzy questioned.

“Well, park employee’s started dressing up as characters, and it became more common for people to take their lunches to them. Finally, when they opened all the restaurants, this picnic spot became less and less popular, so they finally took it off the map and never bothered to clear away the statues,” Mary summarized.

“We found the cottage and started doing our magic there,” Sara finished.

Sara and Mary led Suzy further through the forest and to the cabin, the witches led Suzy inside. The witches had indeed made themselves right at home, the dwarves shelves and tables were now covered with potion ingredients, on their piano was a large black book of spells, and the magic mirror hung over the kitchen window.

“Come in, come in my dear,” a new voice announced.

Suzy looked and saw a third woman with red hair. “Hi,” Suzy greeted, “my name is” she began.

“Oh no need for that dear,” the third witch assured her, “my name is Agatha, but you may call me Aggy.”

“Okay, Agatha,” Suzy responded, “I’m here because.”

“Oh poppet, I already know why you’re here,” Agatha smiled. “Now, you are lonely, and your brother doesn't care about you, luckily we can fix both problems.” Agatha waved her hand, and a projection of Kyle appeared on the magic mirror. “Now listen up honey, we can brew you a potion to turn your brother into a girl younger than you,” the projection of Kyle suddenly shifted into a five-year-old girl wearing Kyle’s shirt like an overlarge dress.

“So,” Suzy watched, “he’d be my little sister?”

“Exactly,” Agatha responded, the projection of little girl Kyle was suddenly joined by a screening of Suzy and the two began running around happily. Suzy also noticed that the little girl Kyle was now wearing a little girl’s dress. “Now, listen dear, this is important all magic has a price, and this is no exception; if you do this you take away your brother's life, all he was will be no more.”

“So it will kill him?” Suzy inquired.

“Not at all dear, Kyle, however, will remember who he is,” the projection of Kyle stopped playing and crossed her arms in anger. “The potion will work until the moment your plane home takes off, got that? The moment your flight home takes to the air. Now, if you can get your brother to want to remain as a little girl he will become one permanently, but if he doesn't he’ll turn back, and he’ll always remember what you did to him. Now keep in mind dear, everyone will know Kyle existed, and even if he wants to stay a little girl you’ll still be taking what he has away from him, that means you will become responsible for your new sister, and you will have to make sure she gets a good life.”

“He’ll have gone through 11th grade for nothing, he’ll have to break up with his girlfriend, and he’ll never be the star of the boy's football team,” Suzy thought aloud.

“That’s right,” Agatha clarified, “so, what do you say?”
12133111.title: Agatha's deal

121331111.content:
“I’ll do it,” Suzy decided.

“Are you sure?” Agatha inquired.

“I’m willing to take the responsibility, if Kyle decides to stay a little girl, then I will take responsibility for her, and if not I will accept whatever he sees fit,” Suzy announced.

“Very well,” Agatha responded, “then we shall make the potion,” Agatha snapped her finger and instantly the fireplace was ablaze with a black cauldron atop it. “Let us begin!”

The three witches began gathering the needed ingredients.

“To change his voice,” Mary announced, “a child’s laugh.”

“Ha, ha, ha!”

“To age him down,” Sara added, “a baby’s hair.” The cauldron began to puff out white smoke.

“To change his gender,” Agatha went on, “a mother’s milk.” She took a carton of milk and added it to the potion.

“For a child’s fear,” Mary said, “a scream of fright!”

“Ahhhhh!”

“For a child’s innocence,” Sara added, “a maiden’s doll.” Sara threw a Barbie doll into the cauldron.

“And lastly,” Agatha said, “an ounce of sugar for childish energy.”

The cauldron blew out pink smoke, and the liquid inside was hot pink as well. Agatha took a small bottle and put some of the potion in it. “If he drinks this, the spell will be enacted.”
121331111.title: Potion

Option 1: A nine year boy attends the food festival, so he would try and eat lots of it as much as he can.

Option 2: A number of Disney Cast Members were on the after hours, when they decided to find some food to fill up their appetites.

1241.content:
It was the opening day of the International Food and Wine Festival at Epcot, and one boy seems to be excited to try so many foods from all across the world. Lewis Wright is nine years of age, and he simply loves to learn more about the food, but also eating lots of it since it was gonna be a great day out for him.

He always wanted to be a good critic when he grows up, and so having to taste lots of food is his prime. Of course going to the festival at Epcot brings Lewis lots of things to try, something he’s never experienced quite like it before until now.

When he walked through the turnstiles and see the iconic Spaceship Earth at the foreground, he could already smell a lot of food, which are all other the place. His reaction says it all, and couldn’t wait to eat it as much as he can.

“Ah! I can even smell it from here. It’s so good!” Lewis says, continue to sniff, as if the food wants him to come over and take a bite out of it.

Of course he didn’t want to waste his own time, and decides it was time he needs to find some food. But the question is where is Lewis heading into first?
1241.title: Lewis attends the Food and Wine Festival

choices: One is 5 and the other is 12

They didn't want to spoil things for their children, Jane and Robert. They wanted to give them a final good memory.The papers were already ready to be filed.

Thanks to Jane's wish, Karen and Richard are reduced to a pair of two-year-old toddlers:

         Karen's graying hair has now lightened to blond and is tied back in a blue ponytail. She is now dressed in a little pink dress, and every time the wind blew one could see the white disposable diaper she wore on underneath.Richard, on the other hand, had his dark hair cut in a buzz-cut. The instant the transformation commenced, however, the two toddlers paused in their tracks and dropped down onto their diapered butts. 12511221211121112112112221.content:
Karen and Richard were now a young couple in their twenties with a five-year-old son Robert, and a seven-month-old baby girl by the name of Jane. Jane had been transformed from her original twelve-year-old appearance. Her blond hair had receded back to peach fuzz, and she no longer had any teeth. She now sat in a dark blue stroller, her little pudgy legs hanging off the side. But -- to her, at least -- the most noticeable difference was how she was dressed.

         Before, when she was twelve, Jane had been wearing a sea-green Avengers T-shirt and a navy skirt, as well as a pair of white sandals. Meanwhile, her hair was tied up in pigtails. Well, now she had no hair, so the pigtails were gone. Instead of a T-shirt and a skirt, she was now wearing a pink onesie, underneath of which she could feel she was wearing a disposable baby diaper. Her sandals had vanished, and she was now completely barefoot. She looked so infantile, and she was finding it difficult to cry about it due to the blue pacifier in her mouth.

         What happens now?

125112212111211121121122211.content:
Jane was miserable, sitting in that stroller. Her five-year-old brother Bobby bent down and started tickling her, while their parents discussed their next plans as if neither of them were even here. She had gone from a preteen girl in sixth grade to a little baby less than a year old, and no one even seemed to realize anything had changed. Jane didn't think she could feel any worse than she did right now.

         That was when something happened that made her realize how wrong she was -- she began to feel herself using her diaper. What does she do?

Jane realized suddenly that she had pooped her diaper without even realizing it. Oh, yes. That was indeed worse than what she had been feeling presently. Since Bobby was bending down to play with his baby sister, the stench reached him first, and so he turned to their mommy -- see that? Jane was already beginning to think of her mother as "Mommy." This scared her. Could her mind be affected?

         "Mommy," Bobby said. "Janie made a stinky."

         Karen walked over and checked Jane's diaper. "Oh, Jane," she cooed. "Looks like someone needs her diaper changed." She turned to Richard. "Why don't you take Bobby on a ride while I get little miss stinky here changed?"

         "Sounds good," said Richard.

         Then Karen, with her baby daughter in her arms, parted ways with her husband and son and headed to the bathroom. While in the bathroom, she laid Jane down on the changing table, undid her onesie, and removed her diaper. Then Jane suffered the humiliation of having her first diaper change in about nine years. For her twelve-year-old mentality, things could not possibly get any worse.

         What now?

When the wind blew a certain way, one could catch a glimpse of the pink Disney Princesses diaper she wore on underneath. She couldn't do much of anything. She'd really prefer being twelve again.

Meanwhile, Jane noted that her faced looked much more weathered and her mouth felt funny.

"My teeth feel strange," she muttered.

"Oh damn, I am a Roberta and not a Robert," she cringed, noting the large breasts and the absence of anything hanging down between the legs.

"Girl, please slow up--can't believe I am saying that," grumbled Jane, as she lost an Ince of height and noted that she carried a large purse.

Richard and Karen Harper smiled, forcefully, as their picture was taken. They didn't want their children to see them angry. It was far too late for that. The two spent more time fighting than not, and they had finally agreed to call it quits.

The one thing they did agree on was loving their children, Jane and Robert, although everyone called him Bobby. Their attempts to cushion the blow of the announcement with a family vacation was probably the worst idea they could have had. To associate Disneyworld with your parent's divorce doesn't seem like a positive association for the happiest place on Earth.

The screen on the back of the seat began to ask them a series of questions that no one who programmed the ride would have recognized.

1251211111211222.title: They Catch Up Finally

12512111112112221.content:
A man approached them. "Excuse me, Jane and Robert Harper?"

Jane frowned. "Yes?"

"I'm Sylvester Shyster," the man said. "I represent the the Walt Disney World Corporation...a subsidiary of the Disney Corporation, charged with running the parks. I'm here to address your situation."

"Situation..."

"You see, Ms. Harper, you made a sincere heartfelt wish on company property." He pulled out a tablet. "I can show you the video feed if you wish. You wished that Richard and Karen Harper were not your parents. That is correct, is it not?"

Jane stared at him. "You were spying on me?"

"Cameras are for security and quality assurance purposes only,' the man told her. "But, in accordance with the terms and conditions of the tickets purchased and your admission into a Disney Park, your wish was automatically granted. Richard and Karen Harper are not your parents. We haven't quite figured out what to do with them yet, so we put them to work, temporarily.

"You are kidding me," Jane insisted.

"Ms. Harper, I never kid," he said. "Now, the issue is this...as you are minors, and you wished away your parents, you do have two choices. You can become emancipated...essentially take on adult responsibilities. Or you can be placed with replacement parents."
12512111112112221.title: Parents Belong to the Park Now

"I want responsibilities! I'm tired of being told what to do!" Jane said, somewhat angrily, somewhat defeated.

"And what about you, young man?"

Karen flashes back to her crash, which causes her clothes to change instead
12512111112221112222211.content:
Karen couldn't believe how Richard was acting, the man was practically racing to Test Track's entrance followed by Jane and Bobby. Karen herself sulked in her movements behind her own kids, who romantically held one another hand. With each step toward the high speed ride, Karen felt more unnerved and self-conscious of how people perceived her. She didn't understand how the fellow tourists didn't balk at the child sized adults leading the two adult sized children across the park.

Everyone treated them like they were normal, worst yet, Karen's teenage feelings felt everyday to her despite the unreality of it all.

When they finally got in line Karen found herself next to Richard who was in a constant state of glee over the ride ahead of them.

"You scared?" Ricky asked her, "Just like the first time you drove a car?"

"Huh?" Karen asked.

Ricky laughed with a boyish grin, "You wrecked your dad's car stupid! Don't you remember?"

Karen did, barely. She couldn't have been older than 15 when she first tried to drive with her learner's permit and ended up crashing the car. No one had been hurt but it seriously affected her willingness to drive in most situations.

"I can't believe you Richard!" Karen yelled. "You're aware and still going alone with this!"

"Kids." Bobby scolded them

"Dad." Karen said to the boy in a wave of embarrassment, "I want to be in the front seat."

The mature boy pondered that, "Ah, I see Karen. You want to test run your first time behind the wheel of a car."

Ricky butted in, "There's no wheel dummy!"

"That attitude Ricky is why you're riding in the back with me." Jane scolded him.

"But mom!" Ricky whined before the teenage girl placed a finger up to his lips to shush him

"I know you choose this ride sweetie." Jane said to him, "But this will be a good experience for your big sister and you'll bother her up front."

"But I'm an adult!" Ricky whined.

"Yes Ricky you are a big kid now" Jane pulled the bigger man into a hug, "but you aren't acting like one."

"But Mom!"

Jane kissed him on the cheek, "We can be nice and snug together in the back. Isn't that better than being being with your sister?"

"I guess." Ricky sighed with a childish disappointment.

Karen soon found herself in the front of the car alongside Bobby who looked like he was going to play at teaching her the works. She giggled at the thought, the anxiety of the high speed coaster relieved somewhat in her mind.

"You ready Speed Racer?" the boy said to her.

"I got this Dad." Karen smiled.

If there was a positive to this surreal role reversal for the Karen, it was seeing how her Jane and little Bobby act as adults. She knew in her heart they were their own unique selves, not just carbon copies of her and Richard. Jane was more outgoing and controlling than she ever been as the mom and Bobby seemed so laid back compared to Richard's high-strung nature.

Maybe...Karen considered before the ride suddenly started leaving the woman sized teen immersed in the moment.
12512111112221112222211.title: Testing Out Their Newfound Youth

choices: Karen's feeling whimsical enough to fly right now.
Karen is having second thoughts. Maybe there's a ride that can fix things.
125121111122211122222111.content:
Karen let out a girlishly squeal when the car launched them at full speed. She was having the time of her life! Her adult worries blew away in the face of the wind just as her screams did.

With each turn the Harper family took on the Test Track, so too were they turned. Karen, the middle age woman she still was, was slowly reverting to the height and proportions of a 15 year old girl. Her legs and arms shrunk every so slowly to match the proportions of a blossoming teenage girl. Her mature hourglass figure remained but dissipated in scale to realistically match her new adolescent height.

"God Dad!" Karen said exhilarated, "That was..."

"Fun right?" Robert asked?

Her little Bobby wasn't so little anymore. Boy he still was, Bobby now had the height and width of a very tall man. One that dwarfed her in her new girlish height.

"Thanks for letting me sit up front!" She thanked her boyish dad with a quick kiss.

"Glad you enjoyed it Karen." He returned an innocent smooch.

Karen rather excitedly got out of her seat when locks where undone and she stood up to take in her transformation. The drop in height was far more impact than she had anticipated and she felt a bit of vertigo to what her brain was long used to experiencing.

"You alright Karen?" Jane called out to her. "You're not having a moment right?"

Red flooded Karen's face, "No, no Mom! It's just the..."

Jane now stood at a woman's height. While she still looked teenage girl to Karen, Jane's new height cemented in Karen the reality of her own change of perspective.

"Ride?" Jane asked, "You sure Karen we can go to the ladies room?"

Looking slightly up at her own daughter brought with it acceptance to Karen that she wasn't in charge anymore, "I'm....sure Mom."

"Woah!!!" shouted Ricky as he nearly tripped out of the car.

Karen couldn't help but laugh at Ricky, He looked cute and ridiculous all at the same time. Middle aged as he was, he was now the size and proportion of every other 5th grader at Epcot. His mature vacation clothes looked all the more silly on his childish frame despite perfectly fitting.

Karen walked up him and gently kept him balanced by his little shoulders, "You alright there shortie?"

Ricky chuckled, "Look who's talking princess."

"What?" Karen asked before catching a glimpse of herself in a reflection. Her soccer mom appearance made her look just as childish as Ricky.

"We're turning into kids again." Ricky admitted with half a smile.

"You certainly are little boy." Karen said.

Ricky ignored the jab, "But what about our kids?'

"Your parents are right here Ricky." Robert informed him by lifting the boy sized man high into the air before bringing him easily back down to earth. "Did you enjoy the ride son?"

"Yeah Dad." Ricky answered.

"Ricky and I had a blast playing backseat driver." Jane commented.

"Are we going to do Soarin' next?" Ricky asked.

"It's Karen's turn to decide." Jane said as she turned to Karen.
125121111122211122222111.title: The Harper Family Gets A Tune-Up

choices: Their clothes changed to match their new ages.
Their hair morphs into age appropriate styles.
1251211111222111222221111.content:
Karen was coming around to this surreal experience. Being 15 years old again, being a kid again, felt so natural to her that she wondered if hadn't always been Jane and Robert's teenage daughter. It felt all too easy to continue playing along to her new role.

"Sure, let's go!" Karen excitedly declared.

The Harper's made their way over to Soarin' and Karen found herself chatting causally to Ricky as their parents walked with their arms wrapped around each other.

"Are we just going to let this happen?" Ricky asked her eventually.

"I guess." Karen answered, "Maybe we should just go with the flow."

"It feels like we're in a dream." Ricky agreed, "Maybe we'll just wake up soon."

"Why would you want to ever wake up?" Karen asked. "Our adult lives were horrible."

"But if we leave Epcot and don't change back." Ricky hesitated, "We'll have to go back to school again. I'll just a 5th grader in elementary school."

Karen giggled, "And I'll be a sophomore in high school. Gosh! I'm so much older than you now Ricky! I'll probably have to babysit you after school too!"

Ricky grimaced, "You always boss me around. You always are so mean to me even though you married me."

Karen felt a ping of pity for her little husband, "I like you Richard, just not as my husband."

"And I like you too Karen." Ricky admitted, "But you annoy me so much."

Karen didn't have time to reply before Jane and Robert butted their way into their private conversation again to announce the obvious. The family had reached Soarin' and with a Fastpass they managed to get aboard the ride fairly easily.

The whimsy which had elevated a girlish excitement in her was long gone with her talk with Ricky but maybe this calming flight through the sky would help. She and Ricky secured themselves in their seats with the expectation that they would surely change once again during the ride.

What transformation occurred?
1251211111222111222221111.title: Karen's feeling whimsical enough to fly rig...

choices: Ricky Asks Bobby Some Pointed Questions
Karen finds out just how different Jane is
12512111112221112222211111.content:
The ride worked by subtly moving the seats as images of gliding over various places played on a giant screen. It gave the sensation of gliding without actually going anywhere.

Karen let herself relax and just went along for the ride. She could feel her concerns just melting away. If things stayed this way, then that was the way it was meant to be. It wasn't as if she had control over it one way or the other.

She got off the ride and paused for a moment. She'd been wearing a pair of jeans and a blouse...standard adult vacation clothes. But now she was wearing shorts and a t-shirt. She looked over at Ricky. He had a Disney shirt on, shorts, and a pair of grubby sneakers.

"Come on," Jane said. "Let's get a move on." She was carrying a purse now, something Karen was not. Karen had been holding a few things in hers for Jane...so she imagined it was the opposite way now. She was about to study her more when Bobby put a hand on her shoulder.

She turned and looked up. Golf shirt, slacks... Childish face or not...he looked very different.

She thought about rides that would appeal to her kids and she finally remembered something that her Jane would have wanted to go on.

"Why don't we ride it Mom?" Karen insisted noticing that Jane didn't turn the tables for once back onto Karen's new teenage persona, "Everybody is a kid at Disney World right?"

"Use my own words against me, why don't you?" Jane said, clearly amused by that. "Fine. But if we head all the way over there, we should stay in World Showcase for a bit. No one's bored with countries, are they?"

Ricky started to object, but Karen grabbed his arm and shot him a look. "It's her favorite," she said to him. He silenced himself.

"Well then," Bobby said, now the tallest of the group. "Let's get going then. It is a bit of a hike."

They started off. Ricky leaned over. "What are you doing?"

"Trying to do something about this crazy situation before I end up having to repeat high school," she said. "Are you in, or do you want to go back to learning long division?"

Ricky made a noise. Karen knew very well math had never been his best subject. They'd gone to school together, although he'd been a grade ahead of her. Oh how the tables had turned there. "What do you want me to do?" He whispered.

125121111122211122222111211.content:
"Go talk to Dad about what it's like to be a kid." Karen suggested.

"What do you mean?" Ricky asked.

"Like, go get him to talk about his own childhood." Karen elaborated, "You know, who he was a couple of hours ago."

"Oh okay." Ricky acknowledge and ran off to catch up to Robert was was leading the family ahead by several paces.

"Dad!" Ricky shouted in a deep voice that seemed childish nonetheless.

"Hey buddy what's up?" Robert asked as he rubbed down his little father's hair.

"Did you go to Disney World when you were a kid?" Ricky asked, knowing the obvious answer.

"I definitely did Ricky." Robert answered, "I was exactly your age as a matter of fact."

"Oh cool." Ricky stated, "What were you like as a kid?"

"Why are you so obsessed with my childhood all of a sudden Ricky?" Robert asked profoundly. "It's been so long since I was a kid your age"

Ricky wasn't sure how to respond to that. Robert had literally just been a kid a couple of rides ago, "I...I just...was wondering if we would have been friends if we were the same age."

"Aren't we already best buds Ricky?" Robert retorted and pulled the smaller man into a half-hug.

Just like when Robert had picked him up, Ricky felt a special wave of magic surge through him at the public affection Robert was giving his boyish self. Ricky struggled to remember if he had ever done the same with Bobby when their roles were reversed. He certainly did when Bobby was a little boy, but as an older kid or even his tween self he realized he had not had a good cuddle with his son for far too long.

He missed this.

"I love you Dad." Ricky said to Robert's delight.

"I love you too son. But to answer your question sport." Robert elaborated, "I think we would be best friends at any age."

"Really?" Ricky childishly asked, "Even if you were 10 years old again."

"I think you would have been a good influence on me Ricky." Robert said suddenly, "I wasn't a very good boy at your age. I never told my own dad that I loved him, I was always too busy in my own world."

"Why?" Ricky asked once again.

"Because your grandparents were going through their divorce at the time. It was really hard on me but I know my dad had it harder. If I had hung out with him more, told him how much I loved him more. Maybe...." Robert trailed off.

Ricky had accomplished the task but the end result only made him want to cry like the kid he was becoming. He had no idea Bobby had felt that way about him. All the times Richard had lazily tried to coax Bobby into passing the football around or watching some action movie with him. If Richard had just pressed Bobby....maybe he would still be the grown man in this relationship.
125121111122211122222111211.title: "Go Talk To Dad about What It's Like to...

choices: Karen consults Ricky and the two concoct a plan to make Jane and Bobby aware.
